text: The earliest recorded incidents of collective civil disobedience took place during the Roman Empire[citation needed].
title: Civil_disobedience

text: Unarmed Jews gathered in the streets to prevent the installation of pagan images in the Temple in Jerusalem.[citation needed][original research?] In modern times, some activists who commit civil disobedience as a group collectively refuse to sign bail until certain demands are met, such as favorable bail conditions, or the release of all the activists.
title: Civil_disobedience

text: This is a form of jail solidarity.[page needed] There have also been many instances of solitary civil disobedience, such as that committed by Thoreau, but these sometimes go unnoticed.
title: Civil_disobedience

text: Thoreau, at the time of his arrest, was not yet a well-known author, and his arrest was not covered in any newspapers in the days, weeks and months after it happened.
title: Civil_disobedience

text: The tax collector who arrested him rose to higher political office, and Thoreau's essay was not published until after the end of the Mexican War.

text: Due to its electronegativity, oxygen forms chemical bonds with almost all other elements to give corresponding oxides.

text: A job where there are many workers willing to work a large amount of time (high supply) competing for a job that few require (low demand) will result in a low wage for that job.
title: Economic_inequality

text: This is because competition between workers drives down the wage.
title: Economic_inequality

text: An example of this would be jobs such as dish-washing or customer service.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Competition amongst workers tends to drive down wages due to the expendable nature of the worker in relation to his or her particular job.
title: Economic_inequality

text: A job where there are few able or willing workers (low supply), but a large need for the positions (high demand), will result in high wages for that job.
title: Economic_inequality

text: This is because competition between employers for employees will drive up the wage.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Examples of this would include jobs that require highly developed skills, rare abilities, or a high level of risk.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Competition amongst employers tends to drive up wages due to the nature of the job, since there is a relative shortage of workers for the particular position.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Professional and labor organizations may limit the supply of workers which results in higher demand and greater incomes for members.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Members may also receive higher wages through collective bargaining, political influence, or corruption.
title: Economic_inequality

text: The party, or parties, that hold the majority of seats in the Parliament forms the Scottish Government.

text: In contrast to many other parliamentary systems, Parliament elects a First Minister from a number of candidates at the beginning of each parliamentary term (after a general election).
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Any member can put their name forward to be First Minister, and a vote is taken by all members of Parliament.

text: Normally, the leader of the largest party is returned as First Minister, and head of the Scottish Government.

text: Theoretically, Parliament also elects the Scottish Ministers who form the government of Scotland and sit in the Scottish cabinet, but such ministers are, in practice, appointed to their roles by the First Minister.

text: The principles of European Union law are rules of law which have been developed by the European Court of Justice that constitute unwritten rules which are not expressly provided for in the treaties but which affect how European Union law is interpreted and applies.

text: In formulating these principles, the courts have drawn on a variety of sources, including: public international law and legal doctrines and principles present in the legal systems of European Union member states and in the jurisprudence of the European Court of Human Rights.

text: Accepted general principles of European Union Law include fundamental rights (see human rights), proportionality, legal certainty, equality before the law and subsidiarity.

text: The Age of Imperialism, a time period beginning around 1700, saw (generally European) industrializing nations engaging in the process of colonizing, influencing, and annexing other parts of the world in order to gain political power.[citation needed] Although imperialist practices have existed for thousands of years, the term "Age of Imperialism" generally refers to the activities of European powers from the early 18th century through to the middle of the 20th century, for example, the "The Great Game" in Persian lands, the "Scramble for Africa" and the "Open Door Policy" in China.

text: Examples of this would include jobs that require highly developed skills, rare abilities, or a high level of risk.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Competition amongst employers tends to drive up wages due to the nature of the job, since there is a relative shortage of workers for the particular position.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Professional and labor organizations may limit the supply of workers which results in higher demand and greater incomes for members.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Members may also receive higher wages through collective bargaining, political influence, or corruption.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Among the most well-known experiments in structural geology are those involving orogenic wedges, which are zones in which mountains are built along convergent tectonic plate boundaries.
title: Geology

text: In the analog versions of these experiments, horizontal layers of sand are pulled along a lower surface into a back stop, which results in realistic-looking patterns of faulting and the growth of a critically tapered (all angles remain the same) orogenic wedge.
title: Geology

text: Numerical models work in the same way as these analog models, though they are often more sophisticated and can include patterns of erosion and uplift in the mountain belt.
title: Geology

text: This helps to show the relationship between erosion and the shape of the mountain range.
title: Geology

text: These studies can also give useful information about pathways for metamorphism through pressure, temperature, space, and time.
title: Geology

text: The Lobata have a pair of lobes, which are muscular, cuplike extensions of the body that project beyond the mouth.
title: Ctenophora

text: Their inconspicuous tentacles originate from the corners of the mouth, running in convoluted grooves and spreading out over the inner surface of the lobes (rather than trailing far behind, as in the Cydippida).
title: Ctenophora

text: Between the lobes on either side of the mouth, many species of lobates have four auricles, gelatinous projections edged with cilia that produce water currents that help direct microscopic prey toward the mouth.
title: Ctenophora

text: This combination of structures enables lobates to feed continuously on suspended planktonic prey.
title: Ctenophora

text: The primary law of the EU consists mainly of the founding treaties, the "core" treaties being the Treaty on European Union (TEU) and the Treaty on the Functioning of the European Union (TFEU).
title: European_Union_law

text: The Treaties contain formal and substantive provisions, which frame policies of the European Union institutions and determine the division of competences between the European Union and its member states.
title: European_Union_law

text: The TEU establishes that European Union law applies to the metropolitan territories of the member states, as well as certain islands and overseas territories, including Madeira, the Canary Islands and the French overseas departments.
title: European_Union_law

text: European Union law also applies in territories where a member state is responsible for external relations, for example Gibraltar and the Åland islands.
title: European_Union_law

text: The TEU allows the European Council to make specific provisions for regions, as for example done for customs matters in Gibraltar and Saint-Pierre-et-Miquelon.
title: European_Union_law

text: The TEU specifically excludes certain regions, for example the Faroe Islands, from the jurisdiction of European Union law.
title: European_Union_law

text: Treaties apply as soon as they enter into force, unless stated otherwise, and are generally concluded for an unlimited period.
title: European_Union_law

text: The TEU provides that commitments entered into by the member states between themselves before the treaty was signed no longer apply.[vague] All EU member states are regarded as subject to the general obligation of the principle of cooperation, as stated in the TEU, whereby member states are obliged not to take measure which could jeopardise the attainment of the TEU objectives.
title: European_Union_law

text: The Court of Justice of the European Union can interpret the Treaties, but it cannot rule on their validity, which is subject to international law.
title: European_Union_law

text: Individuals may rely on primary law in the Court of Justice of the European Union if the Treaty provisions have a direct effect and they are sufficiently clear, precise and unconditional.
title: European_Union_law

text: Planetary geologists have measured different abundances of oxygen isotopes in samples from the Earth, the Moon, Mars, and meteorites, but were long unable to obtain reference values for the isotope ratios in the Sun, believed to be the same as those of the primordial solar nebula.
title: Oxygen

text: Analysis of a silicon wafer exposed to the solar wind in space and returned by the crashed Genesis spacecraft has shown that the Sun has a higher proportion of oxygen-16 than does the Earth.
title: Oxygen

text: The measurement implies that an unknown process depleted oxygen-16 from the Sun's disk of protoplanetary material prior to the coalescence of dust grains that formed the Earth.
title: Oxygen

text: All of these processes do not necessarily occur in a single environment, and do not necessarily occur in a single order.
title: Geology

text: The Hawaiian Islands, for example, consist almost entirely of layered basaltic lava flows.
title: Geology

text: The sedimentary sequences of the mid-continental United States and the Grand Canyon in the southwestern United States contain almost-undeformed stacks of sedimentary rocks that have remained in place since Cambrian time.
title: Geology

text: Other areas are much more geologically complex.
title: Geology

text: In the southwestern United States, sedimentary, volcanic, and intrusive rocks have been metamorphosed, faulted, foliated, and folded.
title: Geology

text: Even older rocks, such as the Acasta gneiss of the Slave craton in northwestern Canada, the oldest known rock in the world have been metamorphosed to the point where their origin is undiscernable without laboratory analysis.
title: Geology

text: In addition, these processes can occur in stages.
title: Geology

text: In many places, the Grand Canyon in the southwestern United States being a very visible example, the lower rock units were metamorphosed and deformed, and then deformation ended and the upper, undeformed units were deposited.
title: Geology

text: Although any amount of rock emplacement and rock deformation can occur, and they can occur any number of times, these concepts provide a guide to understanding the geological history of an area.
title: Geology

text: In addition to the Riemann hypothesis, many more conjectures revolving about primes have been posed.
title: Prime_number

text: Often having an elementary formulation, many of these conjectures have withstood a proof for decades: all four of Landau's problems from 1912 are still unsolved.
title: Prime_number

text: One of them is Goldbach's conjecture, which asserts that every even integer n greater than 2 can be written as a sum of two primes.
title: Prime_number

text: As of February 2011[update], this conjecture has been verified for all numbers up to n = 2 · 1017.
title: Prime_number

text: Weaker statements than this have been proven, for example Vinogradov's theorem says that every sufficiently large odd integer can be written as a sum of three primes.
title: Prime_number

text: Chen's theorem says that every sufficiently large even number can be expressed as the sum of a prime and a semiprime, the product of two primes.
title: Prime_number

text: Also, any even integer can be written as the sum of six primes.
title: Prime_number

text: The branch of number theory studying such questions is called additive number theory.
title: Prime_number

text: The Yuan dynasty is considered both a successor to the Mongol Empire and an imperial Chinese dynasty.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: It was the khanate ruled by the successors of Möngke Khan after the division of the Mongol Empire.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: In official Chinese histories, the Yuan dynasty bore the Mandate of Heaven, following the Song dynasty and preceding the Ming dynasty.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: The dynasty was established by Kublai Khan, yet he placed his grandfather Genghis Khan on the imperial records as the official founder of the dynasty as Taizu.[b] In the Proclamation of the Dynastic Name (《建國號詔》), Kublai announced the name of the new dynasty as Great Yuan and claimed the succession of former Chinese dynasties from the Three Sovereigns and Five Emperors to the Tang dynasty.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: In connectionless mode each packet includes complete addressing information.
title: Packet_switching

text: The packets are routed individually, sometimes resulting in different paths and out-of-order delivery.
title: Packet_switching

text: Each packet is labeled with a destination address, source address, and port numbers.
title: Packet_switching

text: It may also be labeled with the sequence number of the packet.
title: Packet_switching

text: This precludes the need for a dedicated path to help the packet find its way to its destination, but means that much more information is needed in the packet header, which is therefore larger, and this information needs to be looked up in power-hungry content-addressable memory.
title: Packet_switching

text: Each packet is dispatched and may go via different routes; potentially, the system has to do as much work for every packet as the connection-oriented system has to do in connection set-up, but with less information as to the application's requirements.
title: Packet_switching

text: At the destination, the original message/data is reassembled in the correct order, based on the packet sequence number.
title: Packet_switching

text: Thus a virtual connection, also known as a virtual circuit or byte stream is provided to the end-user by a transport layer protocol, although intermediate network nodes only provides a connectionless network layer service.
title: Packet_switching

text: Studies on income inequality and growth have sometimes found evidence confirming the Kuznets curve hypothesis, which states that with economic development, inequality first increases, then decreases.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Economist Thomas Piketty challenges this notion, claiming that from 1914 to 1945 wars and "violent economic and political shocks" reduced inequality.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Moreover, Piketty argues that the "magical" Kuznets curve hypothesis, with its emphasis on the balancing of economic growth in the long run, cannot account for the significant increase in economic inequality throughout the developed world since the 1970s.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Helper T cells express T cell receptors (TCR) that recognize antigen bound to Class II MHC molecules.
title: Immune_system

text: The MHC:antigen complex is also recognized by the helper cell's CD4 co-receptor, which recruits molecules inside the T cell (e.g., Lck) that are responsible for the T cell's activation.
title: Immune_system

text: Helper T cells have a weaker association with the MHC:antigen complex than observed for killer T cells, meaning many receptors (around 200–300) on the helper T cell must be bound by an MHC:antigen in order to activate the helper cell, while killer T cells can be activated by engagement of a single MHC:antigen molecule.
title: Immune_system

text: Helper T cell activation also requires longer duration of engagement with an antigen-presenting cell.
title: Immune_system

text: The activation of a resting helper T cell causes it to release cytokines that influence the activity of many cell types.
title: Immune_system

text: Cytokine signals produced by helper T cells enhance the microbicidal function of macrophages and the activity of killer T cells.
title: Immune_system

text: In addition, helper T cell activation causes an upregulation of molecules expressed on the T cell's surface, such as CD40 ligand (also called CD154), which provide extra stimulatory signals typically required to activate antibody-producing B cells.
title: Immune_system

text: After strengthening his government in northern China, Kublai pursued an expansionist policy in line with the tradition of Mongol and Chinese imperialism.

title: Yuan_dynasty

title: Yuan_dynasty

title: Yuan_dynasty

title: Yuan_dynasty

title: Yuan_dynasty

text: The Mongols defeated the loyalists at the battle of Yamen in 1279.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: The last Song emperor drowned, bringing an end to the Song dynasty.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: The conquest of the Song reunited northern and southern China for the first time in three hundred years.
title: Yuan_dynasty

text: The Standard Industrial Classification and the newer North American Industry Classification System have a classification system for companies that perform or otherwise engage in construction.
title: Construction

text: To recognize the differences of companies in this sector, it is divided into three subsectors: building construction, heavy and civil engineering construction, and specialty trade contractors.
title: Construction

text: There are also categories for construction service firms (e.g., engineering, architecture) and construction managers (firms engaged in managing construction projects without assuming direct financial responsibility for completion of the construction project).

text: Stage 1 is the first, or introductory stage of the bill, where the minister or member in charge of the bill will formally introduce it to Parliament together with its accompanying documents – Explanatory Notes, a Policy Memorandum setting out the policy underlying the bill, and a Financial Memorandum setting out the costs and savings associated with it.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Statements from the Presiding Officer and the member in charge of the bill are also lodged indicating whether the bill is within the legislative competence of the Parliament.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Stage 1 usually takes place, initially, in the relevant committee or committees and is then submitted to the whole Parliament for a full debate in the chamber on the general principles of the bill.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: If the whole Parliament agrees in a vote to the general principles of the bill, it then proceeds to Stage 2.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Steam engines frequently possess two independent mechanisms for ensuring that the pressure in the boiler does not go too high; one may be adjusted by the user, the second is typically designed as an ultimate fail-safe.
title: Steam_engine

text: Such safety valves traditionally used a simple lever to restrain a plug valve in the top of a boiler.
title: Steam_engine

text: One end of the lever carried a weight or spring that restrained the valve against steam pressure.
title: Steam_engine

text: Early valves could be adjusted by engine drivers, leading to many accidents when a driver fastened the valve down to allow greater steam pressure and more power from the engine.
title: Steam_engine

text: The more recent type of safety valve uses an adjustable spring-loaded valve, which is locked such that operators may not tamper with its adjustment unless a seal illegally is broken.
title: Steam_engine

text: This arrangement is considerably safer.[citation needed]
title: Steam_engine

text: Of particular concern with Internet pharmacies is the ease with which people, youth in particular, can obtain controlled substances (e.g., Vicodin, generically known as hydrocodone) via the Internet without a prescription issued by a doctor/practitioner who has an established doctor-patient relationship.
title: Pharmacy

text: There are many instances where a practitioner issues a prescription, brokered by an Internet server, for a controlled substance to a "patient" s/he has never met.[citation needed] In the United States, in order for a prescription for a controlled substance to be valid, it must be issued for a legitimate medical purpose by a licensed practitioner acting in the course of legitimate doctor-patient relationship.
title: Pharmacy

text: The filling pharmacy has a corresponding responsibility to ensure that the prescription is valid.
title: Pharmacy

text: Often, individual state laws outline what defines a valid patient-doctor relationship.
title: Pharmacy

text: NASA's CALIPSO satellite has measured the amount of dust transported by wind from the Sahara to the Amazon: an average 182 million tons of dust are windblown out of the Sahara each year, at 15 degrees west longitude, across 1,600 miles (2,600 km) over the Atlantic Ocean (some dust falls into the Atlantic), then at 35 degrees West longitude at the eastern coast of South America, 27.7 million tons (15%) of dust fall over the Amazon basin, 132 million tons of dust remain in the air, 43 million tons of dust are windblown and falls on the Caribbean Sea, past 75 degrees west longitude.

text: The Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) is a scientific intergovernmental body under the auspices of the United Nations, set up at the request of member governments.
title: Intergovernmental_Panel_on_Climate_Change

text: It was first established in 1988 by two United Nations organizations, the World Meteorological Organization (WMO) and the United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP), and later endorsed by the United Nations General Assembly through Resolution 43/53.
title: Intergovernmental_Panel_on_Climate_Change

text: Membership of the IPCC is open to all members of the WMO and UNEP.
title: Intergovernmental_Panel_on_Climate_Change

text: The IPCC produces reports that support the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC), which is the main international treaty on climate change.
title: Intergovernmental_Panel_on_Climate_Change

text: The ultimate objective of the UNFCCC is to "stabilize greenhouse gas concentrations in the atmosphere at a level that would prevent dangerous anthropogenic [i.e., human-induced] interference with the climate system".
title: Intergovernmental_Panel_on_Climate_Change

text: IPCC reports cover "the scientific, technical and socio-economic information relevant to understanding the scientific basis of risk of human-induced climate change, its potential impacts and options for adaptation and mitigation."
title: Intergovernmental_Panel_on_Climate_Change

text: The Presiding Officer (or Deputy Presiding Officer) decides who speaks in chamber debates and the amount of time for which they are allowed to speak.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Normally, the Presiding Officer tries to achieve a balance between different viewpoints and political parties when selecting members to speak.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Typically, ministers or party leaders open debates, with opening speakers given between 5 and 20 minutes, and succeeding speakers allocated less time.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: The Presiding Officer can reduce speaking time if a large number of members wish to participate in the debate.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Debate is more informal than in some parliamentary systems.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Members may call each other directly by name, rather than by constituency or cabinet position, and hand clapping is allowed.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: Speeches to the chamber are normally delivered in English, but members may use Scots, Gaelic, or any other language with the agreement of the Presiding Officer.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: The Scottish Parliament has conducted debates in the Gaelic language.
title: Scottish_Parliament

text: According to geographic scholars under colonizing empires, the world could be split into climatic zones.
title: Imperialism

text: These scholars believed that Northern Europe and the Mid-Atlantic temperate climate produced a hard-working, moral, and upstanding human being.
title: Imperialism

text: Alternatively, tropical climates yielded lazy attitudes, sexual promiscuity, exotic culture, and moral degeneracy.
title: Imperialism

text: The people of these climates were believed to be in need of guidance and intervention from the European empire to aid in the governing of a more evolved social structure; they were seen as incapable of such a feat.
title: Imperialism

text: Similarly, orientalism is a view of a people based on their geographical location.
title: Imperialism

text: The 2007 Lisbon Treaty explicitly recognised fundamental rights by providing in Article 6(1) that "The Union recognises the rights, freedoms and principles set out in the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union of 7 December 2000, as adopted at Strasbourg on 12 December 2007, which shall have the same legal value as the Treaties." Therefore, the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union has become an integral part of European Union law, codifying the fundamental rights which were previously considered general principles of European Union law.
title: European_Union_law

text: In effect, after the Lisbon Treaty, the Charter and the Convention now co-exist under European Union law, though the former is enforced by the European Court of Justice in relation to European Union measures, and the latter by the European Court of Human Rights in relation to measures by member states.
title: European_Union_law

text: This means that in a closed system of particles, there are no internal forces that are unbalanced.
title: Force

text: That is, the action-reaction force shared between any two objects in a closed system will not cause the center of mass of the system to accelerate.

text: The IPCC does not carry out research nor does it monitor climate related data.

text: According to IPCC guidelines, authors should give priority to peer-reviewed sources.

text: Authors may refer to non-peer-reviewed sources (the "grey literature"), provided that they are of sufficient quality.

text: Economist Joseph Stiglitz presented evidence in 2009 that both global inequality and inequality within countries prevent growth by limiting aggregate demand.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Economist Branko Milanovic, wrote in 2001 that, "The view that income inequality harms growth – or that improved equality can help sustain growth – has become more widely held in recent years.
title: Economic_inequality

text: The main reason for this shift is the increasing importance of human capital in development.
title: Economic_inequality

text: When physical capital mattered most, savings and investments were key.
title: Economic_inequality

text: Then it was important to have a large contingent of rich people who could save a greater proportion of their income than the poor and invest it in physical capital.
title: Economic_inequality

text: But now that human capital is scarcer than machines, widespread education has become the secret to growth."
title: Economic_inequality

text: The War of the Austrian Succession (whose North American theater is known as King George's War) formally ended in 1748 with the signing of the Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle.
title: French_and_Indian_War

text: The treaty was primarily focused on resolving issues in Europe.
title: French_and_Indian_War

text: The issues of conflicting territorial claims between British and French colonies in North America were turned over to a commission to resolve, but it reached no decision.
title: French_and_Indian_War

title: French_and_Indian_War

title: French_and_Indian_War

text: To make new legislation, TFEU article 294 defines the "ordinary legislative procedure" that applies for most EU acts.
title: European_Union_law

text: The essence is there are three readings, starting with a Commission proposal, where the Parliament must vote by a majority of all MEPs (not just those present) to block or suggest changes, and the Council must vote by qualified majority to approve changes, but by unanimity to block Commission amendment.
title: European_Union_law

text: Where the different institutions cannot agree at any stage, a "Conciliation Committee" is convened, representing MEPs, ministers and the Commission to try and get agreement on a joint text: if this works, it will be sent back to the Parliament and Council to approve by absolute and qualified majority.
title: European_Union_law

text: This means, legislation can be blocked by a majority in Parliament, a minority in the Council, and a majority in the Commission: it is harder to change EU law than stay the same.
title: European_Union_law

text: A different procedure exists for budgets.
title: European_Union_law

text: For "enhanced cooperation" among a sub-set of at least member states, authorisation must be given by the Council.
title: European_Union_law

text: Member state governments should be informed by the Commission at the outset before any proposals start the legislative procedure.
title: European_Union_law

text: The EU as a whole can only act within its power set out in the Treaties.
title: European_Union_law

text: TEU articles 4 and 5 state that powers remain with the member states unless they have been conferred, although there is a debate about the Kompetenz-Kompetenz question: who ultimately has the "competence" to define the EU's "competence".
title: European_Union_law

text: Many member state courts believe they decide, other member state Parliaments believe they decide, while within the EU, the Court of Justice believes it has the final say.
title: European_Union_law

text: Civil disobedience is usually defined as pertaining to a citizen's relation to the state and its laws, as distinguished from a constitutional impasse in which two public agencies, especially two equally sovereign branches of government, conflict.

text: For instance, if the head of government of a country were to refuse to enforce a decision of that country's highest court, it would not be civil disobedience, since the head of government would be acting in her or his capacity as public official rather than private citizen.
title: Civil_disobedience

title: Heavy Traffic

text: The film, which begins, ends, and occasionally combines with live-action, explores the often surreal fantasies of a young New York cartoonist named Michael Corleone, using pinball imagery as a metaphor for inner-city life.

text: Pizza delivery is a service in which a pizzeria or pizza chain delivers a pizza to a customer.

title: Pizza delivery

title: Pizza delivery

text: Round table refers to the Central Round Table ("Zentraler Runder Tisch") that convened in East Berlin on December 7, 1989, the day after Egon Krenz, the new head of the Socialist Unity Party (SED) government, resigned.
title: East German Round Table

text: This Round Table, modeled after the Polish Round Table convened in April 1989, was initiated by the group Democracy Now.
title: East German Round Table

text: It was set up as a forum in which members of East German government organizations (such as the so-called block parties, trade unions, the women’s league, etc.) came together with representatives of the new citizens’ movements (such as Democracy Now, Democratic Awakening, and New Forum) to discuss and advance reforms in the German Democratic Republic (East Germany), advising the executive until new national elections could be held.
title: East German Round Table

text: There were 39 representatives at the Central Round Table, 33 with voting rights.
title: East German Round Table

text: Seventeen of them represented new oppositional groups and political parties, and 16 were from political parties and organizations that had been part of the official East German government.
title: East German Round Table

text: Three, representing women, consumers and environmentalists, had observer status.
title: East German Round Table

text: The final three members were the moderators, all clergymen, from the Protestant, Catholic and Methodist churches, who did not have the right to vote.
title: East German Round Table

text: At first most participants hoped to reform the East German government and thus retain the country’s independence, but as popular opinion moved towards rapid unification with West Germany, these hopes were dashed.
title: East German Round Table

text: The Round Table is King Arthur's famed table in the Arthurian legend, around which he and his Knights congregate.
title: Round Table

text: As its name suggests, it has no head, implying that everyone who sits there has equal status.
title: Round Table

text: The table was first described in 1155 by Wace, who relied on previous depictions of Arthur's fabulous retinue.
title: Round Table

text: The symbolism of the Round Table developed over time; by the close of the 12th century it had come to represent the chivalric order associated with Arthur's court, the Knights of the Round Table.
title: Round Table

text: Round Table Pizza is a large chain of pizza parlors in the western United States.

text: Magnolia virginiana, most commonly known as sweetbay magnolia, or merely sweetbay (also laurel magnolia, swampbay, swamp magnolia, whitebay, or beaver tree), is a member of the magnolia family, Magnoliaceae.
title: Magnolia virginiana

text: It was the first magnolia to be scientifically described under modern rules of botanical nomenclature, and is the type species of the genus "Magnolia"; as "Magnolia" is also the type genus of all flowering plants (magnoliophytes), this species in a sense typifies all flowering plants.
title: Magnolia virginiana

text: Chloranthaceae is a family of flowering plants (angiosperms), the only family in the order Chloranthales.
title: Chloranthaceae

text: It is not closely related to any other family of flowering plants, and is among the early-diverging lineages in the angiosperms.
title: Chloranthaceae

text: They are woody or weakly woody plants occurring in Southeast Asia, the Pacific, Madagascar, Central and South America, and the West Indies.
title: Chloranthaceae

text: The family consists of four extant genera, totalling about 77 known species according to Christenhusz and Byng in 2016.
title: Chloranthaceae

text: Some species are used in traditional medicine.
title: Chloranthaceae

text: The type genus is "Chloranthus".
title: Chloranthaceae

text: Zeltnera is a genus of flowering plants in the gentian family.
title: Zeltnera

text: It was erected in 2004 when the genus "Centaurium" (the centauries) was split.
title: Zeltnera

text: Genetic analysis revealed that "Centaurium" was polyphyletic, made up of plants that could be grouped into four clades. Each became a genus.
title: Zeltnera

text: "Centaurium" remained, but it is now limited to the Eurasian species.
title: Zeltnera

text: The Mexican species now belong to genus "Gyrandra", and the Mediterranean and Australian plants are in genus "Schenkia".
title: Zeltnera

text: The new name "Zeltnera" was given to this genus, which contains most of the North American centauries.
title: Zeltnera

text: There are about 25 species.
title: Zeltnera

text: Austrobaileyales is an order of flowering plants, consisting of about 100 species of woody plants growing as trees, shrubs and lianas.
title: Austrobaileyales

text: Perhaps the most familiar species is "Illicium verum", from which comes the spice star anise.
title: Austrobaileyales

text: The order belongs to the group of basal angiosperms, the ANA grade, which diverged earlier from the remaining flowering plants, and, as such, it is the extant group after the Amborellales and Nymphaeales, that is sister to all remaining extant angiosperms outside of the ANA grade.
title: Austrobaileyales

text: The order includes just three families of flowering plants, the Austrobaileyaceae, a monotypic family containing the sole genus, "Austrobaileya scandens", a woody liana, the Schisandraceae, a family of trees, shrubs, or lianas containing essential oils, and the Trimeniaceae, essential oil-bearing trees and lianas.
title: Austrobaileyales

text: Semele ( ; Greek: Σεμέλη "Semelē"), in Greek mythology, daughter of the Boeotian hero Cadmus and Harmonia, was the mortal mother of Dionysus by Zeus in one of his many origin myths.
title: Semele

text: Echinacea is a genus, or group of herbaceous flowering plants in the daisy family.
title: Echinacea

text: The "Echinacea" genus has nine species, which are commonly called purple coneflowers.
title: Echinacea

text: They are found only in eastern and central North America, where they are found growing in moist to dry prairies and open wooded areas.
title: Echinacea

text: They have large, showy heads of composite flowers, blooming from early to late summer.
title: Echinacea

text: The generic name is derived from the Greek word ἐχῖνος ("ekhinos"), meaning "hedgehog," due to the spiny central disk.
title: Echinacea

text: These flowering plants and their parts have different uses.
title: Echinacea

text: Some species are cultivated in gardens for their showy flowers.
title: Echinacea

text: "Echinacea purpurea" is used in folk medicine.
title: Echinacea

text: Two of the species, "E. tennesseensis" and "E. laevigata", are listed in the United States as endangered species.
title: Echinacea

text: Gnetophyta is a division of plants, grouped within the gymnosperms (which also includes conifers, cycads, and ginkgos), that consists of some 70 species across the three relict genera: "Gnetum" (family Gnetaceae), "Welwitschia" (family Welwitschiaceae), and "Ephedra" (family Ephedraceae).
title: Gnetophyta

text: Fossilized pollen attributed to a close relative of "Ephedra" has been dated as far back as the Early Cretaceous.
title: Gnetophyta

text: Though diverse and dominant in the Tertiary, only three families, each containing a single genus, are still alive today.
title: Gnetophyta

text: The primary difference between gnetophytes and other gymnosperms is the presence of vessel elements, a system of conduits that transport water within the plant, similar to those found in flowering plants. Because of this, gnetophytes were once thought to be the closest gymnosperm relatives to flowering plants, but more recent molecular studies have largely disproven this hypothesis.
title: Gnetophyta

text: Anemopaegma is a genus of flowering plants in the family Bignoniaceae.
title: Anemopaegma

text: Species of Anemopaegma along with many other unrelated plants go by the name of catuaba.
title: Anemopaegma

text: Semele is a genus of flowering plants native to the Canary Islands and Madeira.
title: Semele (plant)

text: In the APG III classification system, it is placed in the family Asparagaceae, subfamily Nolinoideae (formerly the family Ruscaceae).
title: Semele (plant)

text: Psychotria is a genus of flowering plants in the Rubiaceae family.
title: Psychotria

text: It contains around 1,850 species and is therefore one of the largest genera of flowering plants.
title: Psychotria

text: The genus has a pantropical distribution and members of the genus are small understorey trees in tropical forests.
title: Psychotria

text: Some species are endangered or facing extinction due to deforestation, especially species of central Africa and the Pacific.
title: Psychotria

text: Koeleria is a common and widespread genus of plants in the grass family, found on all continents except Antarctica and on various oceanic islands.
title: Koeleria

text: It includes species known generally as Junegrasses.
title: Koeleria

text: Virgilia is a genus of Southern African trees in the family Fabaceae, having shiny to hairy pinnate leaves and attractive mauve to pink pea-shaped flowers followed by leathery pods.
title: Virgilia (plant)

text: They are valued as useful ornamental trees by gardeners, particularly the well-known species "Virgilia divaricata" ('Tree in a Hurry', 'Cape Lilac', 'Blossom Tree') and "Virgilia oroboides" ('Pink Blossom Tree'), despite having a comparatively short life (15 years).
title: Virgilia (plant)

text: They prefer well drained soils; some will then grow 2m in the first season.
title: Virgilia (plant)

text: They will tolerate wind and have dense foliage growing close to the ground, so they are useful as pioneer species for privacy and wind protection.
title: Virgilia (plant)

text: The common name in South Africa (in Afrikaans) is keurboom, meaning 'choice tree'.
title: Virgilia (plant)

text: Edward F. Wente (born 1930) is an American professor emeritus of Egyptology and the Department of Near Eastern Languages and Civilizations at the University of Chicago.
title: Edward F. Wente

text: He received his Ph.D from the University of Chicago in 1959 and lectured there from 1963 to 1996.
title: Edward F. Wente

text: He is also a longstanding member of the Oriental Institute, Chicago.
title: Edward F. Wente

text: One of his major works is "Letters from Ancient Egypt" (1990), published by the Scholarly Press.
title: Edward F. Wente

text: In 1999 the Oriental Institute published a collection of essays by Egyptologists in honor of Edward Wente" "Gold of Praise: Studies on Ancient Egypt in Honor of Edward F. Wente"".
title: Edward F. Wente

text: There Goes My Baby (also released as The Last Days of Paradise) is a 1994 American coming-of-age comedy-drama film written and directed by Floyd Mutrux and starring Dermot Mulroney, Rick Schroder, Noah Wyle, Lucy Deakins, and Kelli Williams.
title: There Goes My Baby (film)

text: Edward Francis Cline (November 4, 1891 – May 22, 1961) was an American screenwriter, actor, writer and director best known for his work with comedians W. C. Fields and Buster Keaton.

text: Edward F. Caldwell & Co., of New York City, was one of the premier designers and manufacturers of electric light fixtures and decorative metalwork from the late 19th to the mid-20th centuries.
title: Edward F. Caldwell & Co.

text: Founded in 1895 by Edward F. Caldwell (1851–1914) and Victor F. von Lossberg (1853–1942), the firm left a legacy of custom designed and finely-made, metal gates, lanterns, chandeliers, ceiling and wall fixtures, floor and table lamps, and other decorative objects that can be found today in many metropolitan area churches, public buildings, offices, clubs, and residences including, the White House (1902 renovation), St. Patrick's Cathedral, New York, New York Public Library, and Rockefeller Center.
title: Edward F. Caldwell & Co.

text: Aloha, Bobby and Rose is a 1975 American road drama film about a young working-class couple who accidentally cause the death of a store clerk during their first date, and go on the run from the law.

text: Gen. Edward F. Jones House is a historic home located at Binghamton in Broome County, New York.
title: Gen. Edward F. Jones House

text: It was constructed in 1872 and is a large 2 ⁄ -story, irregularly shaped building built of an eclectic combination of materials and textures.
title: Gen. Edward F. Jones House

text: It was part of a large estate assembled by General Edward F. Jones (1828–1913) by 1883.
title: Gen. Edward F. Jones House

text: The foundation and first floor are constructed of brick while the upper stories are of wood with shingle, beaded board, and clapboard siding.
title: Gen. Edward F. Jones House

text: It is an exceptional example of the Queen Anne style.
title: Gen. Edward F. Jones House

text: The Colour and the Shape is the second studio album by the American rock band Foo Fighters.
title: The Colour and the Shape

text: Produced by Gil Norton, it was released through Capitol Records and the group's own Roswell Records on May 20, 1997.
title: The Colour and the Shape

text: The record is the debut of the Foo Fighters as a group, as the band's previous record, "Foo Fighters" (1995), was primarily recorded by frontman Dave Grohl and friend Barrett Jones as a demo.
title: The Colour and the Shape

text: After the project ballooned and became an international success, the group convened for pre-production in the fall of 1996 and brought in producer Norton to establish a pop sensibility for the tracks.
title: The Colour and the Shape

text: The band strived to create a full-fledged rock record, although the music press predicted another grunge offshoot.
title: The Colour and the Shape

text: The discography of Foo Fighters, an American rock band formed in 1994 by Dave Grohl, consists of nine studio albums, four extended plays (EPs), six video albums, and 36 singles.

title: Foo Fighters discography

title: The Nation Blue

text: Foo Fighters is an American rock band, formed in Seattle, Washington in 1994.
title: Foo Fighters

text: It was founded by Nirvana drummer Dave Grohl as a one-man project following the dissolution of Nirvana after the death of Kurt Cobain.
title: Foo Fighters

text: The group got its name from the UFOs and various aerial phenomena that were reported by Allied aircraft pilots in World War II, which were known collectively as "foo fighters".
title: Foo Fighters

text: Sunny Day Real Estate was an American emo band from Seattle, Washington.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: They were one of the early emo bands and helped establish the genre.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: In 1994, the band released their debut album "Diary" on Sub Pop Records to critical acclaim.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: However, shortly after releasing their second album "LP2", the band broke up, with members Nate Mendel and William Goldsmith joining Foo Fighters and Jeremy Enigk embarking on a solo career.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: In 1997, they regrouped long enough to record two more studio albums and a live album but ultimately disbanded once again in 2001.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: The band reunited again in 2009.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: Bassist Nate Mendel, who chose to remain with Foo Fighters during the previous reunion in 1997, took part in this reunion.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: In a 2013 interview with MusicRadar, Mendel said Sunny Day Real Estate was inactive.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: According to Mendel, the band attempted to record a full-length album after the end of their reunion tour, but the sessions "just fell apart".
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: In 2014 the band released one song from those sessions, "Lipton Witch," on a split 7" vinyl with Circa Survive on Record Store Day.
title: Sunny Day Real Estate

text: The Fire Theft was an American rock band from Seattle, Washington.
title: The Fire Theft

text: They were formed in 2001 by vocalist/guitarist Jeremy Enigk, bassist Nate Mendel, and drummer William Goldsmith, all of whom were previously members of Sunny Day Real Estate.
title: The Fire Theft

text: Mendel also plays bass for Foo Fighters, and Goldsmith drummed for Foo Fighters between 1995 and 1997.
title: The Fire Theft

text: This lineup was identical to the original line up of Sunny Day Real Estate but with the exception of guitarist Dan Hoerner.
title: The Fire Theft

text: While the band went on a hiatus in 2004, there was never an announcement of an official breakup.
title: The Fire Theft

text: Awolnation is an American alternative rock band, formed and fronted by Aaron Bruno, formerly of Under the Influence of Giants, Home Town Hero, and Insurgence.
title: Awolnation

text: The band is signed to Red Bull Records, and their first EP, "Back from Earth", was released on iTunes on May 18, 2010.

title: Awolnation

text: The song has been certified 6× platinum by the RIAA and has sold 5,500,000 copies in the United States.
title: Awolnation

text: As of February 29, 2016, the album has been certified platinum.
title: Awolnation

text: Foo Fighters is an American alternative rock band formed by multi-instrumentalist and vocalist Dave Grohl in 1994.
title: List of Foo Fighters band members

text: After recording the album "Foo Fighters" alone, Grohl enlisted guitarist Pat Smear, bassist Nate Mendel and drummer William Goldsmith to join the band.
title: List of Foo Fighters band members

text: Outrage!
title: Outrage! (game)

text: , "the official Tower of London board game", was first created in 1992 by Imperial Games.
title: Outrage! (game)

text: Players move about the board, which depicts the Tower of London, and attempt to steal the British Crown Jewels.
title: Outrage! (game)

text: In reality, the only modern attempt to steal the Jewels was made in 1671 by Thomas Blood and his accomplices, who failed to escape — an earlier attempt in the early fourteenth century was equally unsuccessful — and the game challenges players to “succeed where they failed.”
title: Outrage! (game)

text: Camel Up is a board game for two to eight players.
title: Camel Up

title: Camel Up

title: Camel Up

text: "Camel Up" won the Spiel des Jahres in 2014.
title: Camel Up

text: Cameline ( ) was a fabric material used in the Middle Ages for cloth.
title: Cameline

text: By tradition it is commonly thought to have been originally made of camel's hair in Asia.
title: Cameline

text: It was imported from Cyprus and Syria into Europe.
title: Cameline

text: Cameline is described also as a cloak of the Arabs made of camel's hair which is oftentimes striped white and brown in color.
title: Cameline

text: Since history records it many times as a "common and cheap" textile it is thought that it was an imitation of the original Asian camel's hair fabric.
title: Cameline

text: It was sometimes a lower quality French cloth imitation made of goat's hair.
title: Cameline

text: The fibers were spun into yarn and produced in Flanders and the Duchy of Brabant in many colors in medieval times.
title: Cameline

text: It is also described as a warm light woolen textile of camel's hair combined with wool or cotton.
title: Cameline

text: It is considered of lesser quality than that of camlet, which is also made of camel's hair.
title: Cameline

text: October Rage formed in 2008 on the Central Coast of New South Wales Australia by brothers Nick and Will Roberts.
title: October Rage

text: They were winners in a songwriting competition for Sydney's TrippleM radio station in 2010 and won the opportunity to open for Bon Jovi in Sydney.
title: October Rage

text: Following this taste of success recorded the band's debut album, "Outrage", released on iTunes September 2011.
title: October Rage

text: "Outrage" lead to the "Outrage tour" of the U.S. 2012-13.
title: October Rage

text: The wild Bactrian camel ("Camelus ferus") is a critically endangered species of camel living in parts of northern China and southern Mongolia.
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: It is closely related to the domesticated Bactrian camel ("Camelus bactrianus").
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: They are both large, even-toed ungulates native to the steppes of central Asia, with a double hump (small and pyramid-shaped).
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: Until recently, wild Bactrian camels were considered to have descended from domesticated Bactrian camels that became feral after escaping from captivity or being returned to the wild.
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: However, a 1.9% difference in mitochondrial DNA suggests a divergence date of 0.7 to 1.5 million years ago, long before the start of domestication.
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: While previously considered to be a subspecies ("Camelus bactrianus ferus") of the Bactrian camel, the latest research establishes the wild Bactrian camel as a separate species from the domesticated Bactrian camel due to its distinct genetic makeup.
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: It is restricted in the wild to remote regions of the Gobi and Taklamakan Deserts of Mongolia and Xinjiang.
title: Wild Bactrian camel

text: Outrage porn refers to any type of media that is designed to invoke outrage for the purpose getting traffic or attention online.
title: Outrage porn

text: The term "outrage porn" was coined by political cartoonist and essayist Tim Kreider of The "New York Times".
title: Outrage porn

text: Coined in 2009, the term was later popularized by author and "Observer" media critic Ryan Holiday.
title: Outrage porn

text: Outrage Coda (アウトレイジ 最終章 ) is a 2017 Japanese yakuza film directed by Takeshi Kitano, starring Kitano (a.k.a. "Beat Takeshi"), and is scheduled for release in Japan on October 7, 2017.
title: Outrage Coda

text: It is a sequel to Kitano's 2012 film, "Beyond Outrage", and completes Kitano's Outrage trilogy started in 2010.
title: Outrage Coda

text: It received its premiere when it was screened out of competition at the 74th Venice International Film Festival.
title: Outrage Coda

text: Injaz (Arabic: إنجاز‎ ‎ , meaning "achievement"; born April 8, 2009) is a female dromedary camel, credited with being the world's first cloned camel.
title: Injaz

text: Dr. Nisar Ahmad Wani, a reproductive biologist and head of the research team at the Camel Reproduction Center in Dubai, United Arab Emirates, announced on April 14, 2009, that the cloned camel was born after an "uncomplicated" gestation of 378 days.
title: Injaz

text: The cloning project had the personal endorsement and financial support of Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, the Prime Minister, Vice President of the United Arab Emirates, and the emir of Dubai.
title: Injaz

text: Prior to this, there had been several unsuccessful attempts in the Emirate to clone a camel.
title: Injaz

text: In public policy, outrage factor is public opposition to a policy that is not based on the knowledge of the technical details.
title: Outrage factor

text: The term "outrage factor" originates from Peter Sandman's 1993 book, "Responding to Community Outrage: Strategies for Effective Risk Communication".
title: Outrage factor

text: A camel is an even-toed ungulate in the genus Camelus, bearing distinctive fatty deposits known as "humps" on its back.
title: Camel

text: The three surviving species of camel are the dromedary, or one-humped camel ("C. dromedarius"), which inhabits the Middle East and the Horn of Africa; the Bactrian, or two-humped camel ("C. bactrianus"), which inhabits Central Asia; and the critically endangered wild Bactrian camel ("C. ferus") that has limited populations in remote areas of northwest China and Mongolia.
title: Camel

text: Bactrian camels take their name from the historical Bactria region of Central Asia (Yam & Khomeiri, 2015).
title: Camel

text: Additionally one other species of camel
title: Camel

text: The Los Angeles Clippers Training Center is a 42500 sqfoot two-story training facility for the Los Angeles Clippers of the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: Los Angeles Clippers Training Center

text: Located in the planned community of Playa Vista in Los Angeles near Loyola Marymount University, the facility is at least 1 mi away from nearby beaches (Playa Del Rey, Marina Del Rey, and Venice), 3 mi north of Los Angeles International Airport, and 12 mi southwest of Staples Center.
title: Los Angeles Clippers Training Center

text: While the team maintains some office functions at Staples Center, the Playa Vista facility serves as the official headquarters of the Clippers.
title: Los Angeles Clippers Training Center

text: The 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season was the 43rd season of the franchise in the National Basketball Association (NBA), their 35th season in Southern California, and their 29th season in Los Angeles.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: During the offseason, the Clippers signed seven-time all-star Grant Hill and re-acquired Lamar Odom from the Dallas Mavericks.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: They improved on their 40–26 record from the previous season to finish 56–26, and they won their first Pacific Division title in franchise history.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: The title was clinched after defeating the Los Angeles Lakers on April 7, which also completed a season sweep of their crosstown rivals, 4–0.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: The franchise had not swept the Lakers since 1974–75, when the Clippers were the Buffalo Braves.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: It was also the first time in 20 years since 1992–93 that the Clippers won the season series against the Lakers.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: Although this was enough to net them home-court advantage in a playoff series for the first time in franchise history, they lost their first-round series to the Memphis Grizzlies in six games.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: Following the season, Hill and Odom both retired and Chauncey Billups re-signed as a free agent with the Detroit Pistons.
title: 2012–13 Los Angeles Clippers season

text: The 2011 NBA All-Star Game was an exhibition basketball game that was played on February 20, 2011 at Staples Center in Los Angeles, California, home of the Los Angeles Clippers and the Los Angeles Lakers.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: This game was the 60th edition of the National Basketball Association (NBA) All-Star Game and was played during the 2010–11 NBA season.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: The Los Angeles Clippers and Los Angeles Lakers served as the hosts.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: The Clippers and Lakers were both awarded the All-Star Game in an announcement by commissioner David Stern on June 9, 2009.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: This was the second time that the Staples Center had hosted the All-Star Game; the arena had previously hosted the event in 2004.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: This will be the fifth time that Los Angeles had hosted the All-Star Game; before Staples Center opened in 1999, the city had previously hosted the event in 1963, 1972, and 1983.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: Rihanna, Kanye West and Drake were the halftime performers, while Keri Hilson, Lenny Kravitz and Bruno Mars were the entertainment for pre-show festivities.
title: 2011 NBA All-Star Game

text: The Lakers–Clippers rivalry is a National Basketball Association (NBA) rivalry between the Los Angeles Lakers and Los Angeles Clippers.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: The two Pacific Division teams both play their home games at Staples Center in Los Angeles, inspiring their matchups to sometimes be called the "Hallway Series".
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: The Lakers relocated from Minneapolis in 1960, while the Clippers moved from San Diego in 1984.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: Los Angeles fans have historically favored the Lakers.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: But the Clippers have sold out every home game at Staples Center since Feb. 2011 and entered the 2016–17 season with the sixth-longest active sellout streak in the NBA.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: The Lakers have won 11 of their 16 NBA championships since moving to Los Angeles.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: Meanwhile, the Clippers have made the playoffs only nine times since 1984 and were long considered the laughingstock of the NBA; in the history of the franchise, they have never advanced past the second round of the playoffs.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: Some contended that the term "rivalry" was inaccurate until the Clippers became more successful.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: For the first time in 20 years, the Clippers won the season series against the Lakers in 2012–13.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: This was the first of five straight season series victories for the Clippers, which included season sweeps in both 2014-15 and 2015-16.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: With the Clippers' 3-1 series win in 2016-17, the Lakers have now won the season series just four times in the past 13 seasons, with five Clippers wins, four Lakers wins, and four ties.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: The Lakers hold a 99–47 advantage in the all-time series against the Clippers.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: The two teams have never met in the playoffs.
title: Lakers–Clippers rivalry

text: Richard Socarides (born November 8, 1954) is an American Democratic political strategist, writer, commentator and a New York attorney.
title: Richard Socarides

text: Socarides was named Head of Public Affairs for Gerson Lehrman Group in August 2013.
title: Richard Socarides

text: He was a White House adviser under United States President Bill Clinton from 1993 to 1999 in a variety of senior positions, including as Special Assistant to the President and Senior Adviser for Public Liaison.
title: Richard Socarides

text: He worked on legal, policy and political issues and served as principal adviser to Clinton on gay and lesbian civil rights issues.
title: Richard Socarides

text: Under Clinton, he was chief operating officer of the 50th Anniversary Summit of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO).
title: Richard Socarides

text: Socarides also worked as special assistant to Senator Tom Harkin (D-Iowa).
title: Richard Socarides

text: From 2000 to 2006, Socarides held senior positions at Time Warner, including at its divisions New Line Cinema and AOL.
title: Richard Socarides

text: Michael J. Green is the Japan Chair and a senior adviser at the Center for Strategic and International Studies (CSIS), as well as an associate professor and Chair in Modern and Contemporary Japanese Politics and Foreign Policy at Georgetown University.
title: Michael Green (political expert)

text: He served as special assistant to the president for national security affairs and senior director for Asian affairs at the National Security Council (NSC) from January 2004 to December 2005 under George W. Bush.
title: Michael Green (political expert)

text: He joined the NSC in April 2001 as director of Asian affairs with responsibility for Japan, Korea, and Australia/New Zealand.
title: Michael Green (political expert)

text: From 1997 to 2000, he was senior fellow for Asian security at the Council on Foreign Relations, where he directed the Independent Task Force on Korea and study groups on Japan and security policy in Asia.
title: Michael Green (political expert)

text: He served as senior adviser to the Office of Asia Pacific Affairs at the Department of Defense in 1997 and as consultant to the same office until 2000.
title: Michael Green (political expert)

text: "Introduction to Metaphysics" (French: ""Introduction à la Métaphysique"") is a 1903 essay about the concept of reality by Henri Bergson.
title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)

text: For Bergson, reality occurs not in a series of discrete states but as a process similar to that described by process philosophy or the Greek philosopher Heraclitus.
title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)

text: Reality is fluid and cannot be completely understood through reductionistic analysis, which he said "implies that we go around an object", gaining knowledge from various perspectives which are relative.
title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)

text: Instead, reality can be grasped absolutely only through intuition, which Bergson expressed as "entering into" the object.
title: Introduction to Metaphysics (Bergson)

text: Duration (French: "la durée") is a theory of time and consciousness posited by the French philosopher Henri Bergson.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: Bergson sought to improve upon inadequacies he perceived in the philosophy of Herbert Spencer, due, he believed, to Spencer's lack of comprehension of mechanics, which led Bergson to the conclusion that time eluded mathematics and science.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: Bergson became aware that the moment one attempted to measure a moment, it would be gone: one measures an immobile, complete line, whereas time is mobile and incomplete.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: For the individual, time may speed up or slow down, whereas, for science, it would remain the same.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: Hence Bergson decided to explore the inner life of man, which is a kind of duration, neither a unity nor a quantitative multiplicity.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: Duration is ineffable and can only be shown indirectly through images that can never reveal a complete picture.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: It can only be grasped through a simple intuition of the imagination.
title: Duration (philosophy)

text: Samuel Eliot Morison, (July 9, 1887 – May 15, 1976) was an American historian noted for his works of maritime history and American history that were both authoritative and popular.
title: Samuel Eliot Morison

text: He received his Ph.D. from Harvard University in 1912, and taught history at the university for 40 years.
title: Samuel Eliot Morison

text: He won Pulitzer Prizes for "Admiral of the Ocean Sea" (1942), a biography of Christopher Columbus, and "John Paul Jones: A Sailor's Biography" (1959).
title: Samuel Eliot Morison

text: In 1942, he was commissioned to write a history of United States naval operations in World War II, which was published in 15 volumes between 1947 and 1962.
title: Samuel Eliot Morison

text: Morison wrote the popular "Oxford History of the American People" (1965), and co-authored the classic textbook "The Growth of the American Republic" (1930) with Henry Steele Commager.
title: Samuel Eliot Morison

text: Over the course of his distinguished career, Morison received eleven honorary doctoral degrees, and garnered numerous literary prizes, military honors, and national awards from both foreign countries and the United States, including two Pulitzer Prizes, two Bancroft Prizes, the Balzan Prize, the Legion of Merit, and the Presidential Medal of Freedom.
title: Samuel Eliot Morison

title: Henri Bergson

title: Thomas Friedman

title: Thomas Friedman

text: Élan vital (] ) is a term coined by French philosopher Henri Bergson in his 1907 book "Creative Evolution", in which he addresses the question of self-organisation and spontaneous morphogenesis of things in an increasingly complex manner.
title: Élan vital

text: "Elan vital" was translated in the English edition as "vital impetus", but is usually translated by his detractors as "vital force".
title: Élan vital

text: It is a hypothetical explanation for evolution and development of organisms, which Bergson linked closely with consciousness – with the intuitive perception of experience and the flow of inner time.
title: Élan vital

text: Time and Free Will: An Essay on the Immediate Data of Consciousness (French: "Essai sur les données immédiates de la conscience") is Henri Bergson's doctoral thesis, first published in 1889.
title: Time and Free Will

text: The essay deals with the problem of free will, which Bergson contends is merely a common confusion among philosophers caused by an illegitimate translation of the unextended into the extended, as a means of introducing his theory of duration, which would become highly influential among continental philosophers in the following century.
title: Time and Free Will

text: Moina Mathers, born Mina Bergson (28 February 1865 – 25 July 1928), was an artist and occultist at the turn of the 20th century.
title: Moina Mathers

text: She was the sister of French philosopher Henri Bergson, the first man of Jewish descent to be awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature in 1927.
title: Moina Mathers

text: She is, however, more known for her marriage to the English occultist, Samuel Liddell MacGregor Mathers, one of the founders of the organisation Hermetic Order of the Golden Dawn and, after his death in 1918, for being the head of a successor organisation, called the Rosicrucian Order of the Alpha et Omega.
title: Moina Mathers

text: Matter and Memory (French: "Matière et mémoire", 1896) is a book by the French philosopher Henri Bergson.
title: Matter and Memory

text: Its subtitle is "Essay on the relation of body and spirit" ("Essai sur la relation du corps à l’esprit"), and the work presents an analysis of the classical philosophical problems concerning this relation.
title: Matter and Memory

text: Within that frame the analysis of memory serves the purpose of clarifying the problem.
title: Matter and Memory

text: "Matter and Memory" was written in reaction to the book "The Maladies of Memory" by Théodule Ribot, which appeared in 1881.
title: Matter and Memory

text: Ribot claimed that the findings of brain science proved that memory is lodged within a particular part of the nervous system; localized within the brain and thus being of a material nature.
title: Matter and Memory

text: Bergson was opposed to this reduction of spirit to matter.
title: Matter and Memory

text: Defending a clear anti-reductionist position, he considered memory to be of a deeply spiritual nature, the brain serving the need of orienting present action by inserting relevant memories.
title: Matter and Memory

text: The brain thus being of a practical nature, certain lesions tend to perturb this practical function, but without erasing memory as such.
title: Matter and Memory

text: The memories are, instead, simply not 'incarnated', and cannot serve their purpose.
title: Matter and Memory

text: The Maitreya Festival (sometimes spelt Maitreyah festival) is a large outdoor music festival held yearly in Melbourne, Australia.

title: Maitreya Festival

text: In terms of outdoor electronic music events (commonly known as Doofs or Bush Doofs in Australia, this makes it the third biggest after Rainbow Serpent and Earthcore.

text: It is the largest Psytrance event in Australia.

text: Maitraya has been said as some to be more “Ideaologically in tune” and less commercial.

text: The W. H. Hobbs Supply Company was a wholesale and retail supplier located in Eau Claire, Wisconsin.
title: W. H. Hobbs Supply Company

text: Founded by William H. Hobbs, it began operation with other partners in 1885, then operated continuously under the Hobbs name from 1907 to 1993.
title: W. H. Hobbs Supply Company

text: The company's services varied greatly over the years, but largely focused on lumber mill supplies, hardware, sporting goods, industrial and creamery supplies, electrical supplies and appliances, and plumbing, heating, water systems and air conditioning materials.
title: W. H. Hobbs Supply Company

text: The company slogan was "Busy since 1885".
title: W. H. Hobbs Supply Company

text: Rolex SA ( ) is a Swiss luxury watchmaker.

text: The company and its subsidiary Montres Tudor SA design, manufacture, distribute and service wristwatches sold under the Rolex and Tudor brands.
title: Rolex

text: Founded by Hans Wilsdorf and Alfred Davis in London, England in 1905 as Wilsdorf and Davis, Rolex moved its base of operations to Geneva, Switzerland in 1919.
title: Rolex

text: Finley Resources is a privately owned and operated energy company headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas, USA].

text: YG Entertainment Inc. (Korean: YG 엔터테인먼트) is a South Korean entertainment company established in 1996 by Yang Hyun-suk.
title: YG Entertainment

title: YG Entertainment

text: In addition, the company operates a number of subsidiary ventures under a separate public traded company - YG PLUS, which includes a clothing line, a golf management agency, and a cosmetics brand.

text: 3DiTeams (also known as 3Di TEAMS) is a first person video game developed by the Duke University Medical Center and Virtual Heroes, Inc. and used for medical education and team training.
title: 3DiTeams

text: The 3DiTeams Project was conceived by Dr. Jeffrey M. Taekman and Jerry Heneghan and is managed by the Human Simulation and Patient Safety Center (HSPSC) at Duke University Medical Center, Durham, North Carolina.
title: 3DiTeams

text: Dr. Taekman, M.D. is an Assistant Professor of Anesthesiology and the Assistant Dean for Educational Technology within the Duke University School of Medicine.
title: 3DiTeams

text: Dr Taekman also serves as chairman of the Society for Simulation in Healthcare's Serious Games / Virtual Environments Special Interest Group.
title: 3DiTeams

text: Co-Principal Investigator for the project is Melanie C. Wright, Ph.D. who is an Assistant Professor human factors engineer in Anesthesiology.
title: 3DiTeams

text: Additional assistance is provided by Noa Segall, Ph.D. and Gene Hobbs, C.H.T..
title: 3DiTeams

text: Recently, the Duke team received funding for the Immersive Learning Environment @ Duke (also known as ILE@D) -- an interactive virtual environment for healthcare distance education.
title: 3DiTeams

text: Orascom Development Holding AG is a holding company that develops hotels, offers real estate, infrastructure, leisure services, and builds and operates vacation resorts.

title: Orascom Development

text: AMCON Distributing Company is an American retail and wholesale consumer commodities sales and distribution company.
title: AMCON Distributing

title: AMCON Distributing

text: The company operates two segments including wholesale distribution segment and retail segment.
title: AMCON Distributing

text: The company also operated sixteen retail health food stores in Florida and the Midwest.
title: AMCON Distributing

title: AMCON Distributing

text: "SOS" is a song by Barbadian singer Rihanna from her second studio album "A Girl like Me" (2006).
title: SOS (Rihanna song)

text: It was written by Jonathan "J.R." Rotem, E. Kidd Bogart and Ed Cobb, with production was handled by Rotem, Carl Sturken and Evan Rogers.
title: SOS (Rihanna song)

text: It was released on February 14, 2006, as the lead single from the album.
title: SOS (Rihanna song)

text: "SOS" is a dance-pop song which samples Soft Cell's 1981 recording of "Tainted Love", a song written by Cobb in 1965.
title: SOS (Rihanna song)

text: Critical reception of "SOS" was generally positive, with the majority of music critics praising the inclusion of the "Tainted Love" sample.
title: SOS (Rihanna song)

text: Some critics compared "SOS" to Rihanna's debut single, "Pon de Replay" ("Music of the Sun", 2005).
title: SOS (Rihanna song)

text: "Pon de Replay" is the debut single recorded by Barbadian singer Rihanna, from her debut studio album "Music of the Sun" (2005).
title: Pon de Replay

text: It was written and produced by Vada Nobles, Alisha Brooks, Carl Sturken and Evan Rogers.
title: Pon de Replay

text: Her debut single, the song was released on May 24, 2005 as the lead single from the album.
title: Pon de Replay

text: Prior to signing a six album record deal with Def Jam Recordings, "Pon de Replay" was one of three songs which was recorded for her demo tape to be sent to record labels.
title: Pon de Replay

text: It is a dance-pop, dancehall and R&B song that features elements of pop and reggae.
title: Pon de Replay

text: The lyrics revolve around Rihanna asking a DJ to turn the volume of her favorite songs up louder.
title: Pon de Replay

text: The name means "play it again" in Bajan Creole, one of Barbados' two official languages.
title: Pon de Replay

text: Vada Nobles is a record producer and songwriter.
title: Vada Nobles

text: He provided production for "Lost Ones" on Lauryn Hill's debut solo album, "The Miseducation of Lauryn Hill" (1998).
title: Vada Nobles

text: He co-wrote and co-produced the Rihanna song "Pon de Replay."
title: Vada Nobles

text: He co-wrote and co-produced the Hilary Duff singles "With Love" and "Stranger" in addition to the album track "Danger" on her 2007 album "Dignity".
title: Vada Nobles

text: He also produced remixes for the Hilary Duff singles "Play with Fire" and "Stranger."
title: Vada Nobles

text: Robyn Hilton (born Robyn Molinaux, c. 1940) is an American film and television actress and model.

text: Hilton was active in the 1970s and 1980s following her debut supporting role as Miss Stein, the secretary to Governor William J. Le Petomane, in Mel Brooks' 1974 comedy film "Blazing Saddles".
title: Robyn Hilton

text: Music of the Sun is the debut studio album by Barbadian singer Rihanna.
title: Music of the Sun

text: It was released on August 30, 2005 in the United States through Def Jam Recordings.
title: Music of the Sun

text: Prior to signing with Def Jam, Rihanna was discovered by record producer Evan Rogers in Barbados, who helped Rihanna record demo tapes to send out to several record labels.
title: Music of the Sun

text: Jay-Z, the former chief executive officer (CEO) and president of Def Jam, was given Rihanna's demo by Jay Brown, his A&R at Def Jam, and invited her to audition for the label after hearing what turned out to be her first single, "Pon de Replay".
title: Music of the Sun

text: She auditioned for Jay-Z and L.A. Reid, the former CEO and president of record label group The Island Def Jam Music Group, and was signed on the spot to prevent her from signing with another record label.
title: Music of the Sun

text: Greensleeves Rhythm Album #27: Diwali, also known as the Diwali Riddim, is an album and popular dancehall riddim that came to prominence in 2002.
title: Diwali Riddim

text: The riddim is credited to Jamaican producer Steven "Lenky" Marsden and appeared on several international hit songs by Sean Paul, Bounty Killer, Elephant Man, Lumidee, Brick & Lace (although its single "Love is Wicked" was not released until 2007), and Wayne Wonder.
title: Diwali Riddim

text: It is recognized as arguably the most prominent and popular riddim of 2002 based on the number of top-ten hit songs that charted in Jamaica or internationally that used the instrumental, such as "Get Busy," "No Letting Go," "Pon de Replay," "Never Leave You (Uh Oooh, Uh Oooh)," "Overcome," "Elephant Message," "Sufferer," "Party Time," and "Love Is Wicked."
title: Diwali Riddim

text: To this day, the riddim and the songs sampling it are still played on Jamaican radio stations every so often and is considered a classic.
title: Diwali Riddim

text: "Pon de Floor" is a song by Major Lazer, a collaborative musical project consisting of the American DJ Diplo and the British DJ Switch.
title: Pon de Floor

text: The single was released in 2009 by Mad Decent and Downtown Records as the second single from Major Lazer's first studio album, "Guns Don't Kill People... Lazers Do" (2009).
title: Pon de Floor

text: The duo wrote the song and produced it with Afrojack with drums by Nebat Drums  and vocals by Vybz Kartel.
title: Pon de Floor

text: "Pon de Floor" is a dancehall and baile funk song and was positively received by music critics.
title: Pon de Floor

text: It appeared on the charts in the United Kingdom in 2010, where it reached number 125.
title: Pon de Floor

text: Eric Wareheim directed the music video for "Pon de Floor", which shows people dry humping, and incorporates daggering choreography.
title: Pon de Floor

text: "Sledgehammer" is a song recorded by Barbadian singer Rihanna.
title: Sledgehammer (Rihanna song)

title: Sledgehammer (Rihanna song)
