title: José Aveiro

text: He played for Sportivo Luqueño, Valencia CF and Elche CF.
title: José Aveiro

text: Drzewica - is a Polish coat of arms that was used by many noble families in medieval Poland and later under the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth.
title: Drzewica coat of arms

text: Łodzia (obsolete Polish for "boat") is a Polish coat of arms.
title: Łodzia coat of arms

text: It was used by many noble families of the Kingdom of Poland and the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth.
title: Łodzia coat of arms

text: A variant serves as the coat of arms of the city of Łódź (the city's name literally means "Boat").
title: Łodzia coat of arms

text: It's a classic example of the so-called "canting arms" well known in European heraldry as it was borne by the medieval lords de Łodzia (a feudal lordship) and their clan.
title: Łodzia coat of arms

text: Hence the boat in the shield, clearly alluding to the estate's name literally meaning "Boat(town)".
title: Łodzia coat of arms

text: Also some unrelated families would bear it who were either legally adopted into the clan by its bloodline members or misattributed to the clan by error or usurpation.
title: Łodzia coat of arms

text: August R. Lindt (born 5 August 1905 in Bern, died 14 April 2000 in Bern), also known as Auguste R. Lindt, was a Swiss lawyer and diplomat.
title: August R. Lindt

text: He served as Chairman of UNICEF from 1953 to 1954 and as United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees from 1956 to 1960.
title: August R. Lindt

text: Count Ferenc Nádasdy de Nádasd et Fogarasföld (6 October 1555 – 4 January 1604) was a Hungarian nobleman.
title: Ferenc Nádasdy

text: His family, Nádasdy, was one of the wealthiest and most influential of the era in Hungary.
title: Ferenc Nádasdy

text: In 1571, when Ferenc was 16, his mother, Orsolya Nádasdy (née Kanizsay), using her association with many noble families in Hungary, organized a marriage to the young Elizabeth Báthory (or Hungarian: Báthory Erzsébet), daughter of the Count György and Anna Báthory.
title: Ferenc Nádasdy

text: The Báthory family were as rich and illustrious as the Nádasdy family, though older and more influential, since they had several relatives who had the charge of Nádor (palatine) of Hungary.
title: Ferenc Nádasdy

text: Among them, included a cardinal, a King of Lithuania-Poland, and a Prince of Transylvania.
title: Ferenc Nádasdy

text: The Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), also known as the UN Refugee Agency, is a United Nations programme mandated to protect and support refugees at the request of a government or the UN itself and assists in their voluntary repatriation, local integration or resettlement to a third country.
title: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

text: Its headquarters are in Geneva, Switzerland, and it is a member of the United Nations Development Group.
title: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

text: The UNHCR has won two Nobel Peace Prizes, once in 1954 and again in 1981.
title: United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees

text: Bengal Institute of Technology & Management (BITM) is a private engineering college adjacent to Santiniketan in the state of West Bengal, India.
title: Bengal Institute of Technology & Management

text: The Institute is situated a few kilometers from the erudite and scholarly hamlet of Santiniketan, which has produced two of India's eminent Noble Prizes winners.
title: Bengal Institute of Technology & Management

text: It is affiliated to West Bengal University of Technology and is approved by the AICTE.
title: Bengal Institute of Technology & Management

text: The college is accredited by NAAC.

text: Kalinowa - is a Polish coat of arms that was used by many noble families in medieval Poland and later under the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth.
title: Kalinowa coat of arms

text: It was used by many noble families known as "szlachta" in Polish in medieval Poland and later under the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth, branches of the original medieval Duninowie ("Łabędzie") family as well as families connected with the Clan by adoption.
title: Łabędź coat of arms

text: Among the independent Albanian principals, which flourished after the middle of the nineteenth century,the most important was that of the Balshaj family originating from the nearby Balz in Shkodra city.
title: Principality of Balshaj

text: During the Serbian invasion , the name of this family remains in the dark.
title: Principality of Balshaj

text: Yet there is reason to suppose that Balshaj was one of many noble Albanian doors,expropriated and mistreated of this area.However, after the mid-nineteenth century, the three Balshaj brothers, Strazimiri, Gjergji I and Balsha II, set this family at the forefront of Albania's state-building process , utilizing the convenient moment that followed the death of car Stefan Dushan.
title: Principality of Balshaj

text: With the dissolution of his Empire, the Balshaj brothers were working to turn Genta, like the former Diocletian, into an independent state from the Serbian kingdom.For this purpose, they cut off any connection with the new Serbian czar yard, Stefan Urosh, who considered Balshaj as "rebellious" and treated them as his controversial opponents.
title: Principality of Balshaj

text: The Lords of Falkenstein in the Höllental (German: "Herren von Falkenstein im Höllental" ) already so-called in von Knobloch's Upper Baden Family Book ("Oberbadischem Geschlechterbuch") of 1898 to 1919, had its main family seat at Falkenstein Castle on a steep hill spur where the narrow Höllental valley opened up into the broad Dreisam valley.
title: House of Falkenstein

text: The name Falkenstein was borne by many noble families; Kindler of Knobloch counted six in the Upper Baden region alone: "im Höllenthale", "auf dem Schwarzwalde", "zu Rimsingen", "am Bodensee", "im Buchsgau", "im Wasgau".
title: House of Falkenstein

text: The MGM Grand Garden Arena (originally known as the MGM Grand Garden Special Events Center) is a multi-purpose arena located within the MGM Grand Las Vegas on the Las Vegas Strip.

text: The bout was held on May 4, 2013, in the MGM Grand Garden Arena at the MGM Grand Hotel & Casino in Las Vegas, Nevada, United States on Showtime PPV.

text: The bout was the first major televised fight of Mayweather's career to not be aired on HBO PPV.

text: The card featured some of the rising stars of Mayweather Promotions: J'Leon Love, Badou Jack, Luis Arias, Ronald Gavril and Lanell Bellows.
title: Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Robert Guerrero

text: Mayweather won via unanimous decision with Guerrero winning the first 3 rounds, then Mayweather adjusted and won from the 4th to 12th round.
title: Floyd Mayweather Jr. vs. Robert Guerrero

text: Human Biology is a peer reviewed scientific journal, currently published by Wayne State University Press.
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: The journal was established in 1929 by Raymond Pearl and is the official publication of the American Association of Anthropological Genetics.
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: The focus of the journal is human genetics, covering topics from human population genetics, evolutionary and genetic demography and quantitative genetics.
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: It also covers ancient DNA studies, evolutionary biological anthropology, and research exploring biological diversity expressed in terms of adaptation.
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: The journal also publishes interdisciplinary research linking biological and cultural diversity from evidence such sources as archaeology, ethnography and cultural anthropology studies, and more.
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: As of July 1, 2016, the journal is on Volume 87, Issue 3.
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: The journal's current editors are Brian M. Kemp (Washington State University) and Ripan S. Malhi (University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign).
title: Human Biology (journal)

text: BioEssays is a monthly peer-reviewed review journal covering molecular and cellular biology.
title: BioEssays

text: Areas covered include genetics, genomics, epigenetics, evolution, developmental biology, neuroscience, human biology, physiology, systems biology, and plant biology.
title: BioEssays

text: The journal also publishes commentaries on aspects of science communication, education, policy, and current affairs.
title: BioEssays

text: Raymond Pearl (3 June 1879 – 17 November 1940) was an American biologist, regarded as one of the founders of biogerontology.
title: Raymond Pearl

text: He spent most of his career at Johns Hopkins University in Baltimore.
title: Raymond Pearl

text: Pearl was a prolific writer of academic books, papers and articles, as well as a committed populariser and communicator of science.
title: Raymond Pearl

text: At his death, 841 publications were listed against his name.
title: Raymond Pearl

text: Economics and Human Biology is a quarterly peer-reviewed academic journal published by Elsevier since 2003.
title: Economics and Human Biology

text: It is an interdisciplinary periodical covering research on biological economics — economics in the context of human biology and health.
title: Economics and Human Biology

text: Typical debates are on nutrition, obesity, height and beauty.
title: Economics and Human Biology

text: Biological economics is an interdisciplinary field in which the interaction of human biology and economics is studied.
title: Biological economics

text: For example, it has been found that chief executives tend to be taller and have wider faces than average.
title: Biological economics

text: The journal "Economics and Human Biology" covers the field and has an impact factor of 2.722.
title: Biological economics

text: Biocultural anthropology can be defined in numerous ways.
title: Biocultural anthropology

text: It is the scientific exploration of the relationships between human biology and culture.
title: Biocultural anthropology

text: "Instead of looking for the biology underlying biological roots of human behavior, biocultural anthropology attempts to understand how culture affects our biological capacities and limitations.
title: Biocultural anthropology

text: Biocultural anthropology attempts to understand challenges to human biology in an ever increasing and diversified cultural environment."
title: Biocultural anthropology

text: The American Journal of Human Biology is a peer-reviewed scientific journal covering human biology.
title: American Journal of Human Biology

text: It is the official publication of the Human Biology Association (formerly known as the Human Biology Council).
title: American Journal of Human Biology

text: The journal publishes original research, theoretical articles, reviews, and other communications connected to all aspects of human biology, health and disease.
title: American Journal of Human Biology

text: The Human Protein Atlas (HPA) is a Swedish-based program started in 2003 with the aim to map of all the human proteins in cells, tissues and organs using integration of various omics technologies, including antibody-based imaging, mass spectrometry-based proteomics, transcriptomics and systems biology.
title: Human Protein Atlas

text: All the data in the knowledge resource is open access to allow scientists both in academia and industry to freely access the data for exploration of the human proteome.
title: Human Protein Atlas

text: The version 17 (launched August 17, 2017) consists of three separate parts, each focusing on a particular aspect of the genome-wide analysis of the human proteins; the Tissue Atlas showing the distribution of the proteins across all major tissues and organs in the human body, the Cell Atlas showing the subcellular localization of proteins in single cells, and finally the new Pathology Atlas showing the impact of protein levels for survival of patients with cancer.
title: Human Protein Atlas

text: The Human Protein Atlas program has already contributed to several thousands of publications in the field of human biology and disease and it was recently (July 25, 2017) selected by the organization ELIXIR as a European core resource due to its fundamental importance for a wider life science community.
title: Human Protein Atlas

text: The HPA consortium is funded by the Knut and Alice Wallenberg Foundation.
title: Human Protein Atlas

text: Zoi Lygerou is a Greek associate professor of biology at the Medical School University of Patras whose works have been published in such journals as the European Journal of Biochemistry, Journal of Cell Science, the Molecular and Cellular Biology journal, Journal of Biological Chemistry, and both Science and Nature journals among others.
title: Zoi Lygerou

text: In 1991 she got her first degree at the University of Athens followed by a Ph.D. from the University of Heidelberg four years later.
title: Zoi Lygerou

text: She also used to be a postdoc at the Imperial Cancer Research Fund of London under guidance from Paul Nurse.
title: Zoi Lygerou

text: On April 12, 1996 she and her colleagues (along with David Tollervey) have discovered that the minimum amount of enzymes are required for the eukaryotes' ribosomal RNA.
title: Zoi Lygerou

text: Annals of Human Biology is a bimonthly academic journal that publishes review articles on human population biology, nature, development and causes of human variation.
title: Annals of Human Biology

text: It is published by Taylor & Francis on behalf of the Society for the Study of Human Biology, of which it is the official journal.
title: Annals of Human Biology

text: The General Campaign Star (French: "Étoile de campagne générale" ) is a campaign medal created in 2004 by the Canadian monarch-in-Council to recognize members of the Canadian Armed Forces who had directly participated in any military campaign under Canadian or allied command.
title: General Campaign Star

text: It is, within the Canadian system of honours, the sixth highest of the war and operational service medals.

text: The Royal Canadian Artillery Museum, Canada’s National Artillery Museum, is a museum dedicated to telling the complete story of the more than 200,000 Canadian Gunners who have served Canada in war and peace since 1855.

text: In 1962, the RCA Museum was established at Canadian Forces Base Shilo in order to preserve and interpret this proud heritage for future generations.
