text: Chris Senn (born December 11, 1972 in Costa Mesa, California, grew up in Grass Valley, California) is a professional skateboarder, known for his aggressive and spontaneous style.
title: Chris Senn (skateboarder)

text: Current and past sponsors include Powell Skateboards Channel one Adrenalin Skateboards Emerica, Ace, Type-S, Paradox, Kamanu Charters and Toy Machine Skateboards.
title: Chris Senn (skateboarder)

text: Notable accomplishments include three X-Games gold medals being ranked 2nd in the World in 2002 behind Rodil de Araujo, Jr, being voted Thrasher Skateboard Magazine Skater Of the Year in 1995 and being a two-time world champion.
title: Chris Senn (skateboarder)

text: A member of the Turkey national boxing team since 1988, Ercument’s amateur career record was 175-25.
title: Ercüment Aslan

text: Highlights include being the Junior world amateur champion in Istanbul in 1994, 3rd at the 1997 World Amateur Boxing Championships in Budapest in 1997 and 2nd at the 1998 European Amateur Boxing Championships.
title: Ercüment Aslan

text: Unfortunately an injury at the World Amateur Championships in Houston in 1999 caused him to miss out on selection for the 2000 Olympic Games.
title: Ercüment Aslan

text: He had a successful professional career with 8 wins and 2 losses.
title: Ercüment Aslan

text: Lin Chung-chiu (traditional Chinese: 林仲秋; born September 23, 1958 in Fengyuan City, Taichung County (now part of Taichung City), Taiwan) is a retired Taiwanese professional baseball player(position: first baseman, outfielder or designated hitter) and currently a baseball coach.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: During the 1980s Lin spent most of his amateur career in Japan and attended the 1988 Olympics for the Chinese Taipei national baseball team.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: After Professional baseball in Taiwan's debut in 1990, Lin left Japan to join CPBL's Mercuries Tigers in July 1990 and stayed with the team until its collapse in November 1999.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: He later played for the Sinon Bulls(2000~2001) and Chinatrust Whales(2002), and retired as a player midway in the Whale's 2002 season.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: Right after his retirement Lin was immediately promoted as the Whale's head coach until the end of CPBL's 2003 season.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: Between 2004 and 2006 Lin ran a small restaurant in his Fengyuan hometown.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: In early 2007, Lin returned to CPBL as Sinon Bulls' hitting coach and holds the position to date.
title: Lin Chung-chiu

text: Alfred "Alfie" Shrubb (12 December 1879 – 23 April 1964) was an English middle and long distance runner.
title: Alfred Shrubb

text: During an amateur career lasting from 1899 to 1905 (when he was barred from amateur competition for receiving payment for running) and a professional career from 1905 to 1912 he won over 1,000 races of about 1,800 started.
title: Alfred Shrubb

text: At the peak of his career he was virtually unbeatable at distances up to 15 miles, often racing against relay teams so that the race would be more competitive.
title: Alfred Shrubb

text: On 4 November 1904, at Ibrox Park, Glasgow, he broke the one hour run record as well as all amateur records from six to eleven miles, and all professional records from eight to eleven miles, running eleven miles, 1137 yards (18.742 km) in one hour.
title: Alfred Shrubb

text: Altogether he set 28 world records.
title: Alfred Shrubb

text: Hudson Riley Hawk (born December 6, 1992), better known as Riley Hawk is an American professional skateboarder.
title: Riley Hawk

text: He is the son of Tony Hawk.
title: Riley Hawk

text: Unlike his father, who is known for his vert style, Riley is better known as a street skater.
title: Riley Hawk

text: Riley turned pro on his 21st birthday in December 2013, and is sponsored by Baker, Lakai Limited footwear.
title: Riley Hawk

text: He was the winner of "Skateboarder"s Amateur of the Year award.
title: Riley Hawk

text: As of August 2013, Skateboarder Magazine is primarily a digital skateboarding publication that produces a limited run of hard copy versions that are sold in skateboard shops.
title: Skateboarder (magazine)

text: The publication was the United States (US)' first skateboarding magazine and, as of August 2013, its Editor/Photo Editor is Jaime Owens, while the magazine's Publisher is Jamey Stone.
title: Skateboarder (magazine)

text: On August 19, 2013, the magazine's owner GrindMedia announced that the publication would cease production on October 15, 2013.
title: Skateboarder (magazine)

text: Juxtapoz Art & Culture Magazine (pronounced Jucks-tah-pose) is a magazine created in 1994 by a group of artists and collectors including Robert Williams, Fausto Vitello, C.R. Stecyk III (a.k.a. Craig Stecyk), Greg Escalante, and Eric Swenson to both help define and celebrate urban alternative and underground contemporary art.
title: Juxtapoz

text: "Juxtapoz" is published by High Speed Productions, the same company that publishes "Thrasher" skateboard magazine in San Francisco, California.
title: Juxtapoz

text: Chirlane Irene McCray (born November 29, 1954) is an American writer, editor, communications professional, and political figure.
title: Chirlane McCray

text: She has published poetry and worked in politics as a speechwriter.
title: Chirlane McCray

text: Married to current New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio, she is the First Lady of New York City.
title: Chirlane McCray

text: They have two children, Chiara and Dante.
title: Chirlane McCray

text: They moved from their home in Park Slope, Brooklyn, into Gracie Mansion, the traditional residence of New York City mayors.
title: Chirlane McCray

text: Lewis P. Dayton (1821–1900) was Mayor of the City of Buffalo, New York, serving 1874–1875.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: He was born at Eden, New York on the family farm in 1821.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: He studied medicine in the office of Dr. Timothy T. Lockwood and moved to Buffalo.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: He graduated in 1846 from the Geneva Medical College, in Geneva, New York.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: He returned to Buffalo as a physician in the Black Rock section.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: Around 1846 he married Grace Webster Holley, who died at a young age.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: Dayton first remarried Mrs. Alice Maud Hayes, who died about a year after their marriage, then in 1892, he married Margaret Vogt.
title: Lewis P. Dayton

text: Kerry Hallam (born 12 March 1937) is a British impressionist artist who has produced approximately twelve thousand paintings and whose work is included in collections held by Brigitte Bardot and Björn Borg as well as decorating the permanent residence of Monaco's Ambassador to the United States.
title: Kerry Hallam

text: Hallam was trained in Chesterfield and London, and has been based in Nantucket since 1981.
title: Kerry Hallam

text: Hallam has developed a reputation as a wise rogue and enjoyed success with exhibitions worldwide, including one entitled "Nude Paintings of Other Men's Future Ex-Wives".
title: Kerry Hallam

text: His work has been shown at art galleries in New York City, London, Paris, Tokyo and Beverly Hills.
title: Kerry Hallam

text: Louise Lawler (born 1947) is a U.S. artist and photographer.
title: Louise Lawler

text: From the late 1970s onwards, Lawler’s work has focused on photographing portraits of other artists’ work, giving special attention to the spaces in which they are placed and methods used to make them.
title: Louise Lawler

text: Examples of Lawler's photographs include images of paintings hanging on the walls of a museum, paintings on the walls of an art collector's opulent home, artwork in the process of being installed in a gallery, and sculpture in a gallery being viewed by spectators.
title: Louise Lawler

text: Along with artists like Cindy Sherman, Laurie Simmons and Barbara Kruger, Lawler is considered to be part of the Pictures Generation.
title: Louise Lawler

text: Louise Lawler lives in Brooklyn, New York.
title: Louise Lawler

text: Archibald Gracie (June 25, 1755 – April 11, 1829) was a Scottish-born shipping magnate and early American businessman and merchant in New York City and Virginia whose spacious home, Gracie Mansion, now serves as the residence of the Mayor of New York City.
title: Archibald Gracie

text: Archibald Gracie Mansion (commonly called Gracie Mansion) is the official residence of the Mayor of the City of New York.
title: Gracie Mansion

text: Built in 1799, it is located in Carl Schurz Park, at East End Avenue and 88th Street in the Yorkville neighborhood of Manhattan.
title: Gracie Mansion

text: The mansion overlooks Hell Gate channel in the East River.
title: Gracie Mansion

text: Stokely Webster (1912 – 2001) was best known as an American impressionist painter who studied in Paris.
title: Stokely Webster

text: His paintings can be found in the permanent collections of many museums, including the Metropolitan Museum of Art in New York, the National Museum of American Art, the Smithsonian Institution, the White House, Gracie Mansion in New York, the Senate Office Building, and the Museum of the City of New York.
title: Stokely Webster

text: Lake Road is an east–west roadway in western New York in the United States.
title: Lake Road (Western New York)

text: It extends for 29 mi from the Irondequoit Bay Outlet Bridge in the Monroe County town of Webster to New York State Route 14 (NY 14) in the Wayne County village of Sodus Point.
title: Lake Road (Western New York)

text: As its name implies, it follows the southern shore of Lake Ontario for its entire length.
title: Lake Road (Western New York)

text: Lake Road serves as the northern terminus of NY 250 and was once the northern terminus of NY 21.
title: Lake Road (Western New York)

text: The entirety of the roadway east of Bay Road in Webster is part of the Seaway Trail, a National Scenic Byway.
title: Lake Road (Western New York)

text: Joseph Alexander Ames (1816–1872) was an American artist, primarily known for portrait and genre painting.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: Originally named Joseph Emes, he was born in Roxbury, New Hampshire.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: Ames began painting at a young age.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: At the age of twelve Henry Theodore Tuckerman wrote about one of his paintings.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: After moderate success at home in Saugus, Massachusetts, he left for Boston in 1841.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: While in Boston, Ames tried to replicate the style of Washington Allston.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: In 1848, Ames traveled to Rome, where he painted a portrait of Pope Pius IX that was featured at the National Academy of Design's annual exhibition in 1850.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: When he returned from Italy he was commissioned by Rufus Choate, Daniel Webster, and Abraham Lincoln.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: He kept a studio in Boston in Amory Hall (ca.1849), and later on Tremont Street (ca.1856), and then on Summer Street.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: Ames exhibited at the Boston Athenæum, the National Academy of Design, and the Pennsylvania Academy.
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: He eventually moved to Baltimore, and then to New York, where he died of a "brain fever".
title: Joseph Alexander Ames

text: Kenneth Lipper is a prominent figure in the arts, the world of finance, and government.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: He served as New York City’s Deputy Mayor under Mayor Ed Koch.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: Mr. Lipper was a General Partner at Lehman Brothers and Salomon Brothers, serving as the investment banker for some of the leading public corporations in the United States and Europe.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: He was Adjunct Professor at Columbia School of International Affairs in the field of international economics.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: Mr. Lipper serves as a director of corporations and government agencies.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: He is Chairman of Lipper & Co, an investment bank and investment management company, and also serves as Chairman of the Board of Lippmann Enterprises LLC, a cosmetics company.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: In November 2010, after winning a civil class action, Lipper was awarded more than $15 million in indemnification, because as a New York State Supreme Court judge’s findings noted, "none of the investigations and claims asserted against [Lipper] had resulted in a finding that he had engaged in 'negligence, malfeasance or a violation of applicable law.'"
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: In 2013, Governor Andrew Cuomo nominated, and the New York State Senate confirmed, Kenneth Lipper as a member of the Board of Commissioners of the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey, the Port Authority’s governing body.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: The Port Authority is a congressionally created bi-state agency which owns and operates JFK International, LaGuardia, and Newark International airports, the bridges and tunnels, PATH railroad, ports and terminals and the World Trade Center.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: Mr. Lipper won an Academy Award in 1998 for producing the best feature-length documentary.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: He is author of the novels Wall Street and City Hall and wrote the original screenplay for the feature film "City Hall."
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: Mr. Lipper was Producer of the feature films: "City Hall", "The Winter Guest" and "The Last Days," as well as Chief Technical Adviser of "Wall Street."
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: He is the co-founder and co-publisher of Lipper Viking Penguin, a celebrated biography series which has published 24 books in multiple languages and countries.
title: Kenneth Lipper

text: Agrilus planipennis, commonly known as the emerald ash borer, is a green buprestid or jewel beetle native to northeastern Asia that feeds on ash species.
title: Emerald ash borer

text: Females lay eggs in bark crevices on ash trees, and larvae feed underneath the bark of ash trees to emerge as adults in one to two years.
title: Emerald ash borer

text: In its native range, it is typically found at low densities and does not cause significant damage to trees native to the area.
title: Emerald ash borer

text: Outside its native range, it is an invasive species and is highly destructive to ash trees native to northwest Europe and North America.
title: Emerald ash borer

text: Prior to being found in North America, very little was known about emerald ash borer in its native range; this has resulted in much of the research on its biology being focused in North America.
title: Emerald ash borer

text: Local governments in North America are attempting to control it by monitoring its spread, diversifying tree species, insecticides, and biological control.
title: Emerald ash borer

text: Geranium lucidum, commonly known as shining cranesbill or (in North America) shining geranium or shiny geranium, is a herbaceous annual plant of the genus "Geranium".
title: Geranium lucidum

text: It is native to Europe, western Asia and North Africa.
title: Geranium lucidum

text: It has been introduced to North America as a garden plant and in places, particularly the Pacific Northwest, has become naturalised and is viewed as an invasive species and noxious weed.
title: Geranium lucidum

text: Populus" section "Aigeiros is a section of three species in the genus "Populus", the poplars.
title: Populus sect. Aigeiros

text: Like some other species in the genus "Populus", they are commonly known as cottonwoods.
title: Populus sect. Aigeiros

text: The species are native to North America, Europe, and western Asia.
title: Populus sect. Aigeiros

text: In the past, as many as six species were recognized, but recent trends have been to accept just three species, treating the others as subspecies of "P. deltoides".
title: Populus sect. Aigeiros

text: Winterhaven (formerly, Karmack) is a census-designated place (CDP) in Imperial County, California.
title: Winterhaven, California

text: Winterhaven is located 6.5 mi east of Pilot Knob, The population was 394 at the 2010 census, down from 529 at the 2000 census.
title: Winterhaven, California

text: It is part of the 'El Centro, California Metropolitan Statistical Area'.
title: Winterhaven, California

text: North of Interstate 8 and bordering Yuma, Arizona, the town is partly located in the Fort Yuma Indian Reservation.
title: Winterhaven, California

text: The Colorado River marks the town's eastern border.
title: Winterhaven, California

text: Alamorio is an unincorporated community in Imperial County, California.
title: Alamorio, California

text: It is located 12.5 mi north-northwest of Holtville, at an elevation of 128 feet (40 m) below sea level.
title: Alamorio, California

text: The community resides along the Alamo River, and was named by combining the Spanish words "alamo" (meaning "poplar" or "cottonwood") and "rio" (meaning "river").
title: Alamorio, California

text: Brassica elongata, the elongated mustard or long-stalked rape, is a species of the mustard plant that is native to parts of Central Europe, Eastern Europe, the Balkan Peninsula, the Caucasus, Morocco and parts of Central Asia.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Through plant invasion this species has become naturalized in many other parts of the world.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Some of these naturalized regions include South Africa, North Western Europe, Australia and North America.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Given the wide range of climate and ecological conditions of these regions, "B. elongata" has been able to disrupt the ecosystems of their native plant habitats and has been label as an invasive species in many of its naturalized zones.
title: Brassica elongata

text: In North America, this species is often found as a roadside weed in the southwestern states, particularly in the state of Nevada.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Studies allude that the Cruciferae might have migrated through the Bering land bridge from what is now Central Asia.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Commonly known as the long-stalked rape or as "langtraubiger Kohl " in German, this species is a close cousin to "Brassica napus" (rapeseed) and a secondary genetic relative to "B. oleracea" (kale).
title: Brassica elongata

text: As a close genetic species of the rapeseed, the long-stalked rape has one of the highest counts of accumulated polyunsaturated linoleic and linolenic acid.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Both compounds are heavily used to manufacture vegetable oils.
title: Brassica elongata

text: "Brassica elongata" has the propagative potential of turning into a horticultural product from what is currently a noxious weed.
title: Brassica elongata

text: Tragopogon dubius (yellow salsify, western salsify, western goat's-beard, wild oysterplant, yellow goat's beard, goat's beard, goatsbeard, common salsify, salsify) is a species of salsify native to southern and central Europe and western Asia and found as far north and west as northern France.
title: Tragopogon dubius

text: Although it has been reported from Kashmir and India, recent evidence suggests that specimens from these areas may be a different species.
title: Tragopogon dubius

text: Western salsify has been introduced into North America where it has become widespread, being reported from all the continental United States except for a few in the far south-east, and all provinces of Canada except Newfoundland and the northern territories.
title: Tragopogon dubius

text: Slab City or The Slabs is largely a snowbird community in the Sonoran Desert located in Imperial County, California, 156 miles northeast of San Diego within the California Badlands, and used by recreational vehicle owners and squatters from across North America.
title: Slab City, California

text: It took its name from concrete slabs that remained from the abandoned World War II Marine Corps barracks of Camp Dunlap.
title: Slab City, California

text: Rhamnus cathartica, the buckthorn, common buckthorn or purging buckthorn, is a species of small tree in the flowering plant family Rhamnaceae.
title: Rhamnus cathartica

text: It is native to Europe, northwest Africa and western Asia, from the central British Isles south to Morocco, and east to Kyrgyzstan.
title: Rhamnus cathartica

text: It was introduced to North America as an ornamental shrub in the early 19th century or perhaps before, and is now naturalized in the northern half of the continent, and is classified as an invasive plant in several US states and in Ontario, Canada.
title: Rhamnus cathartica

text: Anacamptis palustris is a species of orchid.
title: Anacamptis palustris

text: It is found in Europe, North Africa and western Asia.
title: Anacamptis palustris

text: This orchid is native to Western and Central Europe, the Mediterranean region, the Balearic Islands, Turkey, Western Asia, Algeria and Tunisia in North Africa, and Saudi Arabia.
title: Anacamptis palustris

text: In 1999, Sanjeev Nanda, then a Wharton Business School student, and son of Indian industrialist Suresh Nanda ran over six people, including three police officers.
title: 1999 Delhi hit-and-run case

text: While Nanda and several related parties were initially acquitted and released in a trial in 1999, Nanda was later found guilty in 2008 and sentenced to two years in prison, which was reduced to time served, a large fine, and two years of community service by the Indian Supreme Court in 2012.
title: 1999 Delhi hit-and-run case

text: The case attracted media attention, and was viewed by "India Today" as "a test of the judicial system's ability to take on the powerful".
title: 1999 Delhi hit-and-run case

text: Mahapadma Nanda (IAST: Mahāpadmānanda) (  400 – c. 329 BCE ) was the first king of the Nanda dynasty.
title: Mahapadma Nanda

text: He was the son of Mahanandin, king of the Shishunaga dynasty and a Shudra mother.
title: Mahapadma Nanda

text: Sons of Mahanandin from his other wives opposed the rise of Mahapadma Nanda, on which he eliminated all of them to claim the throne.
title: Mahapadma Nanda

text: Nakhon Noi briefly occupied the throne of Lan Xang from 1582–1583 on the death of his father Sen Soulintha, who himself had been appointed as a vassal to the Toungoo Empire from 1580-1582.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Nakhon Noi took the regnal name "Samdach Brhat Chao Samdach Brhat Chao Negara Nawi Raja Sri Sadhana Kanayudha".
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Little is known about his brief rule, it does not appear in the sources that the Burmese were at the origin of his selection to succeed Sen Soulintha and were instead informed belatedly.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: If he had supporters in the royal court of Lan Xang they were few and quickly became unhappy with his rule.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Within the year the royal court had petitioned King Nanda Bayin for his removal.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: According to various versions of the chronicles it is cited that Nakhon Noi “did not rule with fairness,” or keep to the religious and behavioral precepts which were traditionally required by a sovereign.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Other versions record that he simply had made enemies at court, or was perceived as illegitimate because (like his father Sen Soulintha) he was of common origins.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Either at the hands of the royal court, or the Burmese, Nakhon Noi was deposed, arrested, and returned to Pegu.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: After Nakhon Noi was deposed a period of interregnum occurred from 1583-1591 which historian Paul Le Boulanger describes as a period of “absolute confusion,” among the factions at court.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: The chronicles again agree that it was only after the period of succession crisis that a petition was finally sent in 1591 to Nanda Bayin by the Lao sangha and Lan Xang court asking for Prince No Muang, the son and legitimate heir of Setthathirath, to be appointed as king.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Nanda Bayin confirmed the request and Prince No Muang would take the throne as Nokeo Koumane and reign Lan Xang from 1591-1596.
title: Nakhon Noi

text: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance (Korean: 삼성화재) (KOSPI # 000810) is an insurance company based in Seoul, South Korea.
title: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance

text: Incorporated on January 26, 1952, under the name of "Korea Anbo Fire Marine Reinsurance Co.", the company changed its name to Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance Co., Ltd., in December 1993, after its takeover by Samsung Group dated back to 1958.
title: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance

text: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance, SFMI in short, is operating property and casualty insurance business and third-party insurance business defined by the Korea Insurance Business Act, while engaging in providing financial services and instruments approved by relevant laws and regulations including the Korea Financial Investment Services and Capital Markets Act.
title: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance

text: Its business portfolio consists of automobile insurance, long-term insurance, general insurance (commercial lines), enterprise risk management, annuities, etc.
title: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance

text: As of the end of 2015, Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance has seven overseas subsidiaries in Indonesia, Vietnam, China, Brazil, Europe, US, and Singapore.
title: Samsung Fire & Marine Insurance

text: The Escorts Group is an Indian engineering company that operates in the sectors of agri-machinery, construction and material handling equipment, railway equipment and auto components.
title: Escorts Group

text: Headquartered in Faridabad, Haryana, the company was launched in 1944 and has marketing operations in more than 40 countries.
title: Escorts Group

text: Escorts Group’s management team includes Rajan Nanda as the Chairman and Managing Director and Nikhil Nanda as the Managing Director.
title: Escorts Group

text: Ritu Nanda (born Ritu Kapoor; 30 October 1948) is a prominent insurance advisor associated chiefly with the life insurance business.
title: Ritu Nanda

text: She is currently the chairman and chief executive officer of Ritu Nanda Insurance Services (RNIS).
title: Ritu Nanda

text: Nanda was initially managing a household appliances manufacturing business Nikitasha which got closed due to poor growth.
title: Ritu Nanda

text: On recommendation of her friend, she decided to be an insurance agent.
title: Ritu Nanda

text: She has more than 55,000 clients, and is the recipient of the "Brand" and the "Best Insurance Advisor" of the Decade awards from the Life Insurance Corporation of India, the largest life insurance company of India.
title: Ritu Nanda

text: Key person insurance, also commonly called keyman insurance and key man insurance, is an important form of business insurance.
title: Key person insurance

text: There is no legal definition for "key person insurance".
title: Key person insurance

text: In general, it can be described as an insurance policy taken out by a business to compensate that business for financial losses that would arise from the death or extended incapacity of an important member of the business.
title: Key person insurance

text: To put it simply, Keyman Insurance is a standard life insurance, TPD insurance or trauma insurance policy that is used for business succession or business protection purposes.
title: Key person insurance

text: The policy's term does not extend beyond the period of the key person’s usefulness to the business.
title: Key person insurance

text: Keyman Insurance policies are usually owned by the business and the aim is to compensate the business for losses incurred with the loss of a key income generator and facilitate business continuity.
title: Key person insurance

text: Key person insurance does not indemnify the actual losses incurred but compensates with a fixed monetary sum as specified on the insurance policy.
title: Key person insurance

text: Patiala House is a 2011 Indian sports drama film directed by Nikhil Advani and starring Akshay Kumar and Anushka Sharma.
title: Patiala House (film)

text: It was produced by Bhushan Kumar, Mukesh Talreja, Krishan Kumar and Twinkle Khanna under the banner of People Tree Films, Credence Motion Pictures and Hari Om Entertainment.
title: Patiala House (film)

text: The film released on 11 February 2011.
title: Patiala House (film)

text: The theatrical trailer of was premièred with Farah Khan's "Tees Maar Khan" on 24 December 2010.
title: Patiala House (film)

text: Akshay Kumar plays the role of a fast bowler, loosely based upon Monty Panesar and its concept was conceived by Rahul Nanda, son of writer Gulshan Nanda.
title: Patiala House (film)

text: Nandvanshi is a term designating the descendants of Nanda (also known as Nandagopa).
title: Nandvanshi

text: According to the "Harivamsha" and the "Puranas", Nanda was the head of the Gopas, a tribe of cowherds referred as "Holy Gwals".
title: Nandvanshi

text: Vasudeva took his new-born son Krishna to Nanda on the night of the child's birth so that Nanda could raise him.
title: Nandvanshi

text: Nikhil Nanda (born 18 March 1974) is an Indian businessman.
title: Nikhil Nanda

text: Part of the Kapoor family, he is the son of insurance agent Ritu Nanda and industrialist Rajan Nanda, and the grandson of actorfilmmaker Raj Kapoor.
title: Nikhil Nanda

text: He is the managing director of Escorts Limited, an engineering company that manufacture agricultural machinery, machine construction and material handling equipment and railway equipment.
title: Nikhil Nanda

text: Escorts Limited was founded in 1948 by his paternal grandfather, Har Prasad Nanda (known as H.P. Nanda).
title: Nikhil Nanda

text: The company’s corporate headquarters is in Faridabad, Haryana, India.
title: Nikhil Nanda

text: He is married to Shweta Bachchan, the daughter of veteran actors Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bhaduriand has two children with her.
title: Nikhil Nanda

text: "Set 'Em Up Joe" is a song co-written and recorded by American country music artist Vern Gosdin.
title: Set 'Em Up Joe

text: It was released in April 1988 as the second single from the album "Chiseled in Stone".
title: Set 'Em Up Joe

text: "Set 'Em Up Joe" was a tribute song to Ernest Tubb and was Vern Gosdin's second number one on the country chart.
title: Set 'Em Up Joe

text: The single went to number one for one week and spent a total of fifteen weeks within the Top 40.
title: Set 'Em Up Joe

text: In 2010, this song was covered by Jamey Johnson on his album "The Guitar Song".
title: Set 'Em Up Joe

text: Gosdin wrote the song with Dean Dillon, Buddy Cannon and Hank Cochran.
title: Set 'Em Up Joe

text: The "Pokémon Theme" (also known as "Gotta Catch 'Em All") is a song written by John Siegler and John Loeffler and performed by Jason Paige.
title: Pokémon Theme

text: It was the theme song for the first season of the English adaptation of the "Pokémon" anime.
title: Pokémon Theme

text: Since its release, the song has been virtually synonymous with the "Pokémon" franchise because the line "Gotta Catch 'Em All" has become its official slogan.
title: Pokémon Theme

text: "Triumphant (Get 'Em)" is a song by American singer and songwriter Mariah Carey.
title: Triumphant (Get 'Em)

text: It was written and produced by Carey, Jermaine Dupri and Bryan-Michael Cox, with additional writing credits and features by American rappers Rick Ross and Meek Mill.
title: Triumphant (Get 'Em)

text: Released on August 3, 2012, Carey revealed that she wrote the song during difficult and personal experiences in her life, and that writing the song helped alleviate the pain.
title: Triumphant (Get 'Em)

text: She later stated that "Triumphant (Get 'Em)" was written when her husband Nick Cannon was in the hospital with acute kidney failure in early 2012, and was also inspired by the death of her past collaborator and friend, Whitney Houston.
title: Triumphant (Get 'Em)

text: Backstreet Boys: Show 'Em What You're Made Of is a 2015 American documentary film about the career of the American vocal group Backstreet Boys, released on January 30, 2015 in the U.S., and was released on February 26, 2015 in the UK and Europe, and March 28, 2015 for the rest of the world.
title: Backstreet Boys: Show 'Em What You're Made Of

text: It was directed by Stephen Kijak.
title: Backstreet Boys: Show 'Em What You're Made Of

text: Kevin Scott Richardson (born October 3, 1971) is an American singer, songwriter, actor and model, best known as a member of the Backstreet Boys.
title: Kevin Richardson (musician)

text: Richardson was inducted into the Kentucky Music Hall of Fame along with his cousin and bandmate Brian Littrell on April 10, 2015.
title: Kevin Richardson (musician)

text: "Show 'Em (What You're Made Of)" is a song by American pop group Backstreet Boys from their eighth studio album "In a World Like This".
title: Show 'Em (What You're Made Of)

text: It was released as the second single from the album on November 18, 2013.
title: Show 'Em (What You're Made Of)

text: The song was written by Morgan Taylor Reid, Mika Guillory, and Backstreet Boys members AJ McLean and Kevin Richardson.
title: Show 'Em (What You're Made Of)

text: "Loved 'Em Every One" is a song written by Phil Sampson, and recorded by American country music artist T.G. Sheppard.
title: I Loved 'Em Every One

text: It was released in March 1981 as the first single from the album "I Love 'Em All".
title: I Loved 'Em Every One

text: "I Loved 'Em Every One" was T.G. Sheppard's seventh number one on the country chart.
title: I Loved 'Em Every One

text: The single stayed at number one for one week and spent ten weeks on the country chart.
title: I Loved 'Em Every One

text: "I Loved' Em Every One" was also Shepperd's only Top 40 single on Billboard's Hot 100, reaching #37.
title: I Loved 'Em Every One

text: "Loving You Could Never Be Better" is a song written by Earl Montgomery, and recorded by American country music artist George Jones.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: It was released in April 1972 as the second single from his album "George Jones (We Can Make It)".
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: The song peaked at number 2 on the "Billboard" Hot Country Singles chart.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: It also reached number 1 on the "RPM" Country Tracks chart in Canada.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: The song was a good example of how producer Billy Sherrill had updated the sound of Jones' records, incorporating a laid back, R&B bass line.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: By drawing from such unlikely and disparate musical influences as Johann Strauss and "wall of sound" rock producer Phil Spector, he gradually began embroidering his own subtle permutations on the rather predictable fabric of country record production.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: "I just decided I'd do it my way, and screw 'em if they didn't like it," Jones biographer Bob Allen quotes Sherrill.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: "Back then, the musicians had their own repertoire of stock Nashville licks and chord progressions that would work on any song.
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: But I often wanted something different, and I'd make 'em play it."
title: Loving You Could Never Be Better

text: "Don't Tell 'Em" is a song by American singer Jeremih from his third studio album, "Late Nights".
title: Don't Tell 'Em

text: It features American rapper YG, and was released as the first single from the album.
title: Don't Tell 'Em

text: The song peaked at number six on the "Billboard" Hot 100.
title: Don't Tell 'Em

text: Outside the United States, "Don't Tell 'Em" peaked within the top ten of the charts in the United Kingdom, as well as the top twenty of the charts in Australia and Belgium.
title: Don't Tell 'Em

text: "Heard 'Em Say" is a song by American hip-hop artist Kanye West.
title: Heard 'Em Say

text: It was released on November 8, 2005 as the third single for his second studio album, "Late Registration".
title: Heard 'Em Say

text: The song features Maroon 5 lead singer Adam Levine, who sings the chorus and bridge.
title: Heard 'Em Say

text: West co-produced the track with Jon Brion, and it contains excerpts from "Someone That I Used to Love" as performed by Natalie Cole.
title: Heard 'Em Say

text: The song was met by acclaim from contemporary music critics and is often seen as one of West's best.
title: Heard 'Em Say

text: The refrain of "Heard 'Em Say" was later recycled for the Maroon 5 song "Nothing Lasts Forever" which appears on their 2007 album "It Won't Be Soon Before Long".
title: Heard 'Em Say

text: The Latah Formation is a series of late Miocene lacustrine sedimentary deposits which outcrop in eastern Washington and northwestern Idaho.
title: Latah Formation

text: The lake beds are interbedded with igneous rock of the Columbia River Basalt Group.
title: Latah Formation

text: The formation was originally named from a site in Spokane, Washington by Dr. Kirk Bryan in 1923.
title: Latah Formation

text: Numerous fossil plants and insects have been recovered from the formation and described.
title: Latah Formation

text: When first described the formation was thought to have predated the deposition of the Columbia River Basalts, however further investigation showed them to be interbedded, being laid down in successive events.
title: Latah Formation

text: Potassium-argon dating of the formation returned an age range of 21.3 to 12.1 million years old, indicating an Early to Middle Miocene age range.
title: Latah Formation

text: Sugardaddyforme.com is an online dating site for sugar daddies and sugar babies (see Age disparity in sexual relationships).
title: Sugardaddyforme.com

text: In 2013 the dating site had over 4 million members and over 2,000 new sugar daddy and sugar baby profiles every day.
title: Sugardaddyforme.com

text: The website gets 1.5 million unique new visitors every month.
title: Sugardaddyforme.com

text: The age range for women is predominantly 18-45 and for men the age range is predominantly 25-60.
title: Sugardaddyforme.com

text: Kent College is a girls independent boarding and day school in Pembury, Kent, England, divided into a preparatory school for the age range three to eleven, and a senior school for the age range eleven to eighteen.
title: Kent College, Pembury

text: It was established in Bouverie Road, Folkestone in 1886 by the Wesleyan Methodist Schools’ Association, but is now an interdenominational Christian school.
title: Kent College, Pembury

text: It is a member of HMC and the Girls' Schools Association, and the prep department is a member of the Independent Association of Preparatory Schools.
title: Kent College, Pembury

text: Christ the King College is a joint Church of England and Catholic secondary school and sixth form college located in Newport on the Isle of Wight.
title: Christ the King College, Isle of Wight

text: It was created in September 2008 by amalgamating two older schools, Archbishop King Catholic Middle School and Trinity Church of England Middle School.
title: Christ the King College, Isle of Wight

text: As such, the school is on two separate campuses, both located close to each other on Wellington Road.
title: Christ the King College, Isle of Wight

text: Having previously accommodated a middle school age range, the school now takes students from years 7 to 13 after its plans to extend the age range and become a Church of England and Catholic secondary school and sixth form.
title: Christ the King College, Isle of Wight

text: The Bobby Smith Trophy is awarded annually to the Ontario Hockey League (OHL) Scholastic Player of the Year who best combines high standards of play and academic excellence.
title: Bobby Smith Trophy

text: The Ontario Hockey League (OHL) is one of the three major junior ice hockey leagues which constitute the Canadian Hockey League.
title: Ontario Hockey League

text: The league is for players aged 16–21.
title: Ontario Hockey League

text: Keith Lavarne Smith (born May 3, 1953 in Palmetto, Florida, United States) is a former Major League Baseball outfielder who played for the Texas Rangers in 1977 and the St. Louis Cardinals from 1979 to 1980.
title: Keith Smith (outfielder)

text: His minor league career spanned from 1972 to 1981.
title: Keith Smith (outfielder)

text: Brother of Bobby Smith who played for the 1973 Marion Mets.
title: Keith Smith (outfielder)

text: Chris Clifford (born May 26, 1966 in Kingston, Ontario) is a retired Canadian professional ice hockey goaltender, who played two games in the National Hockey League with the Chicago Black Hawks.
title: Chris Clifford

text: He filled in for Murray Bannerman in a 1985 game and for Ed Belfour in a 1989 game.
title: Chris Clifford

text: He won the Bobby Smith Trophy in 1985-86.
title: Chris Clifford

text: Clifford was drafted in the sixth round of the 1984 NHL Entry Draft.
title: Chris Clifford

text: He spent his junior career with the Ontario Hockey League's Kingston Canadians and most of his professional career with various teams in the International Hockey League.
title: Chris Clifford

text: Clifford became the first goaltender in Ontario Hockey League history to score a goal.
title: Chris Clifford

text: The 1977–78 season was Port Vale's 66th season of football in the Football League, and their eighth successive season (14th overall) in the Third Division.
title: 1977–78 Port Vale F.C. season

text: Finishing in 21st place, they were relegated to the Fourth Division.
title: 1977–78 Port Vale F.C. season

text: Roy Sproson was sacked in October after a poor start to the season, though things did not improve under his replacement Bobby Smith, despite Smith spending big money to bring in new players.
title: 1977–78 Port Vale F.C. season

text: Smith also left the club at the end of the season.
title: 1977–78 Port Vale F.C. season

text: A Junior school is a type of school which provides primary education to children, often in the age range from 8 and 13, following attendance at Infant school which covers the age range 5-7.
title: Junior school

text: (As both Infant and Junior schools are giving Primary Education pupils are commonly placed in a unified building housing the age ranges of both Infants and Juniors - a Primary school).
title: Junior school

text: Moses Rischin (born 1925) is an American Jewish historian, author, lecturer, editor, and emeritus professor of history at San Francisco State University.
title: Moses Rischin

text: He coined the phrase new Mormon history in a 1969 article of the same name.
title: Moses Rischin

text: Rischin is from New York City.
title: Moses Rischin

text: His undergraduate studies were at Brooklyn College.
title: Moses Rischin

text: Harvard University awarded him a PhD in 1957.
title: Moses Rischin

text: In addition to his professorship, he sits on the board for the "Journal of American Ethnic History" and on the council of the American Jewish History Society.
title: Moses Rischin

text: There is an annual lecture given in his honor at the Western Jewish History Center, where he is director.
title: Moses Rischin

text: There is a collection of historical essays published in Rischin's honor, and a supporting character, Meyer Meyer in the 87th Precinct series, may have been partly modeled after him.
title: Moses Rischin

text: Arnold Richards, M.D., is a psychoanalyst and former editor of "The American Psychoanalyst" and "Journal of the American Psychoanalytic Association (JAPA)".
title: Arnold Richards

text: Richards also is the Training and Supervising Analyst at the New York Psychoanalytic Institute.
title: Arnold Richards

text: He is the founder and Editor-in-Chief of the International Psychoanalysis.net magazine.
title: Arnold Richards

text: Richards is a board member and former chair of YIVO.
title: Arnold Richards

text: Gershon Galil is Professor of Biblical Studies and Ancient History and former chair of the Department of Jewish History at the University of Haifa, Mount Carmel, Haifa, Israel.
title: Gershon Galil

text: Jeffrey S. Gurock is Libby M. Klaperman Professor of Jewish History at Yeshiva University.
title: Jeffrey S. Gurock

text: He has written over a dozen books in the field of American Jewish history and also served as associate editor to "American Jewish History", the most important journal in that field, from 1982 to 2002.
title: Jeffrey S. Gurock

text: His work focuses on the American Orthodox community and the variations in Orthodox practice and ritual over the course of American Jewish history.
title: Jeffrey S. Gurock

text: His books include "Orthodox Jews in America" (Indiana University Press, 2009), a comprehensive social and cultural history of this group and its relations to other Jews and mainstream American society, and "Jews in Gotham" (New York University Press, 2012), which chronicles New York Jewry from 1920 to 2010.
title: Jeffrey S. Gurock

text: YIVO (Yiddish: ייִוואָ , ] ), established in 1925 in Wilno in the Second Polish Republic (now Vilnius, Lithuania) as the Yidisher Visnshaftlekher Institut (Yiddish: ייִדישער װיסנשאַפֿטלעכער אינסטיטוט , ] , Yiddish Scientific Institute), is an organization that preserves, studies, and teaches the cultural history of Jewish life throughout Eastern Europe, Germany and Russia, as well as orthography, lexicography, and other studies related to Yiddish.
title: YIVO

text: (The word "yidisher" means both "Yiddish" and "Jewish".)
title: YIVO

text: The English name of the organization was changed to the Institute for Jewish Research subsequent to its relocation to New York City, although it is still primarily known by its Yiddish acronym.
title: YIVO

text: YIVO is now a member of the Center for Jewish History.
title: YIVO

text: It serves as the "de facto" recognized language regulator of the Yiddish language.
title: YIVO

text: David N. Myers (born 1960) is the President & CEO of the Center for Jewish History in New York.
title: David N. Myers

text: He is also a professor of history at the University of California, Los Angeles, where he holds the Sady and Ludwig Kahn Chair in Jewish History.
title: David N. Myers

text: His research focuses on modern Jewish intellectual and cultural history.
title: David N. Myers

text: The Center for Jewish History is a partnership of five Jewish history, scholarship, and art organizations in New York City: American Jewish Historical Society, American Sephardi Federation, Leo Baeck Institute New York, Yeshiva University Museum, and YIVO Institute for Jewish Research.
title: Center for Jewish History

text: Together, housed in one location, the partners have separate governing bodies and finances, but collocate resources.
title: Center for Jewish History

text: The partners' collections make up the biggest repository of Jewish history in the United States.
title: Center for Jewish History

text: The Center for Jewish History serves as a centralized place of scholarly research, events, exhibitions, and performances.
title: Center for Jewish History

text: Located within the Center are the Lillian Goldman Reading Room, Ackman & Ziff Family Genealogy Institute and a Collection Management & Conservation Wing.
title: Center for Jewish History

text: The Center for Jewish History is also an affiliate of the Smithsonian Institution.
title: Center for Jewish History

text: Carole Beth Balin (born 1964) is a Reform Jewish rabbi and professor of Jewish history at Hebrew Union College-Jewish Institute of Religion in New York City.
title: Carole B. Balin

text: Her research interests include Eastern European and American Jewish history, the history of Reform Judaism, and gender studies.
title: Carole B. Balin

text: She received laudatory reviews for her 2003 book "To Reveal Our Hearts: Jewish Women Writers in Tsarist Russia", and has co-edited two other books.
title: Carole B. Balin

text: She is a co-curator of "Bat Mitzvah Comes of Age", a traveling exhibition sponsored by the Smithsonian-affiliated National Museum of American Jewish History and the Moving Traditions Jewish non-profit.
title: Carole B. Balin

text: Prof. Dr. Hikmet Tanyu (1918 – 1992), from Turkey, was a scientist and college professor of philosophy and history of religions who specialized in Jewish religious history.
title: Hikmet Tanyu

text: He studied in Israel in the 1970s and wrote a book titled "Jews and Turks throughout History" which examines Jewish history and relations between Jewish and Turkish societies through history.
title: Hikmet Tanyu

text: This book is considered as the first serious approach to the Jewish history in Turkey.
title: Hikmet Tanyu

text: Israel Bartal (born October 22, 1946 in Tel Aviv, Israel), is Avraham Harman Professor of Jewish History, and the former Dean of the Faculty of Humanities at Hebrew University (2006–2010).
title: Israel Bartal

text: Since 2006 he is the chair of the Historical Society of Israel.
title: Israel Bartal

text: He served as director of the Center for Research on the History and Culture of Polish Jewry, and the academic chairman of the Project of Jewish Studies in Russian at the Hebrew University of Jerusalem.
title: Israel Bartal

text: Professor Bartal was the co-director of the Center for Jewish Studies and Civilization at Moscow State University.
title: Israel Bartal

text: Bartal received his PhD from Hebrew University in 1981.
title: Israel Bartal

text: He focuses his research on the history of the Jews in Palestine, the Jews of Eastern Europe, the Haskalah Movement, Jewish Orthodoxy and modern Jewish historiography.
title: Israel Bartal

text: Tweedledum and Tweedledee are fictional characters in an English nursery rhyme and in Lewis Carroll's "Through the Looking-Glass, and What Alice Found There".
title: Tweedledum and Tweedledee

text: Their names may have originally come from an epigram written by poet John Byrom .
title: Tweedledum and Tweedledee

text: The nursery rhyme has a Roud Folk Song Index number of 19800.
title: Tweedledum and Tweedledee

text: The names have since become synonymous in western popular culture slang for any two people who look and act in identical ways, generally in a derogatory context.
title: Tweedledum and Tweedledee

text: "A Wise Old Owl" is an English language nursery rhyme.
title: A Wise Old Owl

text: It has a Roud Folk Song Index number of 7734 and in The Oxford Dictionary of Nursery Rhymes, 2nd Ed.
title: A Wise Old Owl

text: of 1997, as number 394.
title: A Wise Old Owl

text: The rhyme is an improvement of a traditional nursery rhyme "There was an owl lived in an oak, wisky, wasky, weedle."
title: A Wise Old Owl

text: Humpty Dumpty is a character in an English nursery rhyme, probably originally a riddle and one of the best known in the English-speaking world.
title: Humpty Dumpty

text: He is typically portrayed as a personified egg, though he is not explicitly described as such.
title: Humpty Dumpty

text: The first recorded versions of the rhyme date from late eighteenth-century England and the tune from 1870 in James William Elliott's "National Nursery Rhymes and Nursery Songs".
title: Humpty Dumpty

text: Its origins are obscure and several theories have been advanced to suggest original meanings.
title: Humpty Dumpty

text: Mots D'Heures: Gousses, Rames: The D'Antin Manuscript ("Mother Goose's Rhymes"), published in 1967 by Luis d'Antin van Rooten is purportedly a collection of poems written in archaic French with learned glosses.
title: Mots d'Heures

text: In fact, they are English-language nursery rhymes written homophonically as a nonsensical French text (with pseudo-scholarly explanatory footnotes); that is, as an English-to-French homophonic translation.
title: Mots d'Heures

text: The result is not merely the English nursery rhyme but that nursery rhyme as it would sound if spoken in English by someone with a strong French accent.
title: Mots d'Heures

text: Even the manuscript's title, when spoken aloud, sounds like "Mother Goose's Rhymes" with a strong French accent.
title: Mots d'Heures

text: "Baa, Baa, Black Sheep" is an English nursery rhyme, the earliest surviving version of which dates from 1731.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: The words have not changed very much in two and a half centuries.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: It is sung to a variant of the 1761 French melody "Ah!
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: vous dirai-je, maman".
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: Uncorroborated theories have been advanced to explain the meaning of the rhyme.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: These include that it is a complaint against Medieval English taxes on wool and that it is about the slave trade.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: In the twentieth century it was a subject of controversies in debates about political correctness.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: It has been used in literature and popular culture as a metaphor and allusion.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: The Roud Folk Song Index classifies the lyrics and their variations as number 4439.
title: Baa, Baa, Black Sheep

text: Andrew William John McCrorie-Shand (né McCrorie) (born 14 May 1955) is a British composer.
title: Andrew McCrorie-Shand

text: He is mostly known for having composed the original theme tune for "Teletubbies", and also the chart topping hit that followed it, "Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"
title: Andrew McCrorie-Shand

text: Rub-A-Dub-Dub was an English nursery rhyme TV series animated by Peter Lang and Alan Rogers of the Cut-Out Animation Co.
title: Rub-a-Dub-Dub (TV series)

text: They were previously famous for Pigeon Street.
title: Rub-a-Dub-Dub (TV series)

text: The series was produced by David Yates and Joe Wolf.
title: Rub-a-Dub-Dub (TV series)

text: The title is a reference to the nursery rhyme Rub-a-dub-dub.
title: Rub-a-Dub-Dub (TV series)

text: Teletubbies – The Album is an album that was released based on the popular children's show of the same name.
title: Teletubbies – The Album

text: The album's single "Teletubbies Say 'Eh-oh!'
title: Teletubbies – The Album

text: " was a number-one hit in the UK Singles Chart in December 1997 and reached number 13 in the Dutch Singles Chart in late 1998.
title: Teletubbies – The Album

text: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: is a hit single which was number one in the UK Singles Chart for two weeks in December 1997.
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: It remained in the Top 75 for 29 weeks after its first release and three weeks more after two re-releases and sold well enough to be certified as double-platinum.
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: It is mostly a remix of the theme song from the hit BBC TV show, "Teletubbies".
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: It was also a massive hit in the Republic of Ireland, peaking at number two.
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: The Teletubbies have not had another such hit, making them a one-hit wonder.
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: The song also reached #13 in The Netherlands, remaining in the Dutch Singles Chart for 13 weeks.
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: The song contains two nursery rhymes, the Teletubbies hum along to Baa, Baa, Black Sheep and the flowers from Teletubbyland sing Mary, Mary, Quite Contrary.
title: Teletubbies say "Eh-oh!"

text: Visits to St Elizabeths is a poem by Elizabeth Bishop modelled on the English nursery rhyme "This is the house that Jack built".
title: Visits to St. Elizabeths

text: The poem refers to the confinement between 1945 and 1958 of Ezra Pound in St Elizabeths Hospital, Washington, D.C.
title: Visits to St. Elizabeths

text: The nursery rhyme style gives an unusual effect to the strange or unsettling descriptions of a psychiatric hospital in the poem.
title: Visits to St. Elizabeths

text: Likewise the poem treats Pound ambivalently describing him by turns as "honored", "brave", "cruel", and "wretched" among other things.
title: Visits to St. Elizabeths

text: Yangtze River Pharmaceutical Group (, YRPG) is a Chinese multinational pharmaceutical corporation headquartered in Taizhou, Jiangsu Province in the People's Republic of China, and with its research headquarters in Shanghai.
title: Yangtze River Pharmaceutical Group

text: It is one of the Asia's largest pharmaceutical companies by revenues, and was listed in 2014 as being China's second largest pharmaceutical manufacturer, and leading company for technological and entrepreneurial innovation.
title: Yangtze River Pharmaceutical Group

text: Merck & Co., Inc. (), d.b.a. Merck Sharp & Dohme (MSD) outside the United States and Canada, is an American pharmaceutical company and one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world.
title: Merck & Co.

text: W. Roy Smythe (born July 14, 1960 in Temple, Texas) is the global Chief Medical Officer for Heallthcare Informatics for Philips .
title: W. Roy Smythe

text: He was previously the Chief Medical Officer for Valence Health, a health care consulting, services and risk management operating firm based in Chicago, Illinois, acquired in 2016 by Evolent.
title: W. Roy Smythe

text: Prior, he was the first Chief Medical Officer of AVIA, a health care innovation firm co-founded by Ted Meisel, formerly President of Yahoo Search Marketing, and Eric Langshur, the founder of CarePages.
title: W. Roy Smythe

text: The Access to Medicine Index is an independent initiative that ranks the world’s 20 largest research-based pharmaceutical companies according to their efforts to improve access to medicine in 107 low- to middle-income countries.
title: Access to Medicine Index

text: The Index assesses how companies are making their products more available, affordable, accessible and acceptable to patients in need.
title: Access to Medicine Index

text: By comparing companies to one another, the Index aims to stimulate pharmaceutical companies to play a bigger part in addressing the challenges of access to medicine in developing countries and to offer them insight into the activities of their peers.
title: Access to Medicine Index

text: Furthermore, the Access to Medicine Index seeks to create a platform for stakeholders from the pharmaceutical industry, governments, investors, civil society, patient organisations and academia to gather and form a common view of how these pharmaceutical companies can make further progress.
title: Access to Medicine Index

text: Sachin H. Jain (born in 1980 in New York City and raised in Alpine, New Jersey) is an American physician and health policy analyst who held leadership positions in the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) and the Office of the National Coordinator for Health Information Technology (ONC).
title: Sachin H. Jain

text: He is president and chief executive officer at the CareMore Health System after serving as Chief Medical Information and Innovation Officer at Merck and Co, lecturer in health care policy at Harvard Medical School, and attending physician at the Boston VA Hospital.
title: Sachin H. Jain

text: He is also co-founder and co-Editor-in-Chief of "Healthcare: The Science of Delivery and Innovation", consulting professor of medicine at the Stanford University School of Medicine, and a Contributor at Forbes.
title: Sachin H. Jain

text: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd. (Hebrew: טבע תעשיות פרמצבטיות בע"מ‎ ) is an Israeli multinational pharmaceutical company headquartered in Petah Tikva, Israel.
title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries

text: It specializes primarily in generic drugs, but other business interests include active pharmaceutical ingredients and, to a lesser extent, proprietary pharmaceuticals.
title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries

text: It is the largest generic drug manufacturer in the world and one of the 15 largest pharmaceutical companies worldwide.
title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries

text: Teva's facilities are located in Israel, North America, Europe, and South America.
title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries

text: Teva shares trade on both the New York Stock Exchange (via ADRs) and the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange.
title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries

text: The company is a member of the Pharmaceutical Research and Manufacturers of America (PhRMA).
title: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries

text: Teva Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (TAPI) is an international pharmaceutical company headquartered in Israel.
title: Teva Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (TAPI)

text: TAPI is a stand-alone business unit of Teva Pharmaceutical Industries limited, the largest generic drug manufacturer in the world and one of the 15 largest pharmaceutical companies worldwide.
title: Teva Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (TAPI)

text: A chief innovation officer (CINO) or chief technology innovation officer (CTIO) is a person in a company who is primarily responsible for managing the process of innovation and change management in an organization, as well as being in some cases the person who "originates new ideas but also recognizes innovative ideas generated by other people".
title: Chief innovation officer

text: The CINO also manages Technological change.
title: Chief innovation officer

text: A chief medical informatics officer (CMIO, also sometimes referred to as a chief medical information officer, or Chief Clinical Information Officer - CCIO in the United Kingdom) is a healthcare executive generally responsible for the health informatics platform required to work with clinical IT staff to support the efficient design, implementation, and use of health technology within a healthcare organization.
title: Chief medical informatics officer

text: The Merck Group, branded and commonly known as Merck, is a German multinational chemical, pharmaceutical and life sciences company headquartered in Darmstadt, with around 50,000 employees in around 70 countries.
title: Merck Group

text: Merck was founded in 1668 and is the world's oldest operating chemical and pharmaceutical company, as well as one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world.
title: Merck Group

text: The 1972–73 New York Knicks season was the 27th season of NBA basketball in New York City.
title: 1972–73 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks capture their second NBA title as they defeated the Los Angeles Lakers in the NBA Finals, four games to one, which was exactly the same count the Knicks lost to the Lakers a year earlier.
title: 1972–73 New York Knicks season

text: The 1967–68 New York Knicks season was the 22nd season for the team in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: 1967–68 New York Knicks season

text: In the regular season, the Knicks finished in second place in the Eastern Division with a 43–39 record, qualifying for the NBA Playoffs for the second consecutive season.
title: 1967–68 New York Knicks season

text: New York lost its opening round series to the Philadelphia 76ers, four games to two.
title: 1967–68 New York Knicks season

text: Willis Reed scored 20.6 points per game and had 13.2 rebounds per game, leading the Knicks in both categories; Frazier had a team-high 4.1 assists per game.
title: 1967–68 New York Knicks season

text: The 1969–70 New York Knicks season was the 24th season of NBA basketball in New York City.
title: 1969–70 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks had a then single-season NBA record 18 straight victories en route to 60–22 record, which was the best regular season record in the team's history.
title: 1969–70 New York Knicks season

text: They set the record for the best start for the first 24 games at 23-1 before the Golden State Warriors surpassed it in 2015.
title: 1969–70 New York Knicks season

text: After defeating the Bullets in the Eastern Division semifinals and the Milwaukee Bucks in the Eastern Division finals, the Knicks defeated the Los Angeles Lakers in seven games to capture their first NBA title.
title: 1969–70 New York Knicks season

text: Bernard King (born December 4, 1956) is an American retired professional basketball player at the small forward position in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: Bernard King

text: He played 14 seasons with the New Jersey Nets, Utah Jazz, Golden State Warriors, New York Knicks and the Washington Bullets.
title: Bernard King

text: He was inducted into the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame on September 8, 2013.
title: Bernard King

text: His younger brother, Albert, has also played in the NBA during his career.
title: Bernard King

text: The 2014–15 New York Knicks season was the 69th season of the franchise in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: 2014–15 New York Knicks season

text: On March 28, the Knicks set a new franchise-record 60 losses in a season, finishing at 65.
title: 2014–15 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks missed the playoffs for the second consecutive season, and for the tenth out of fourteen since 2001–02.
title: 2014–15 New York Knicks season

text: This particular season has been commonly referred to as the worst season in Knicks history as it was the first time they had lost more than 60 games in franchise history.
title: 2014–15 New York Knicks season

text: The Lakers also lost more than 60 games that year, leaving the Utah Jazz as the sole franchise to not have a 60+ losing record.
title: 2014–15 New York Knicks season

text: The 1983–84 New York Knicks season was the 38th season for the team in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: 1983–84 New York Knicks season

text: In the regular season, the Knicks had a 47–35 record, and qualified for the NBA Playoffs as the fifth seed in the Eastern Conference.
title: 1983–84 New York Knicks season

text: New York was led by small forward Bernard King, who averaged 26.3 points per game (PPG) in the regular season and 34.8 PPG in the playoffs.
title: 1983–84 New York Knicks season

text: In early 1984, King scored 50 points in consecutive games, against the San Antonio Spurs and Dallas Mavericks.
title: 1983–84 New York Knicks season

text: The 1968–69 New York Knicks season was the 23rd season for the team in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: 1968–69 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks finished third in the Eastern Division with a 54–28 regular season record, and qualified for the NBA Playoffs for the third straight year.
title: 1968–69 New York Knicks season

text: In the first round of the playoffs, New York defeated the Baltimore Bullets in a four-game sweep to earn a berth in the Eastern Division Finals.
title: 1968–69 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks lost the division finals to the eventual NBA champion Boston Celtics in six games.
title: 1968–69 New York Knicks season

text: Willis Reed scored a team-best 21.1 points per game for the Knicks; Walt Frazier led the team with 7.9 assists per game and Reed averaged 14.5 rebounds per game.
title: 1968–69 New York Knicks season

text: The 1977–78 New York Knicks season was the 32nd season for the team in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: 1977–78 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks finished the regular season in second place in the Atlantic Division with a 43–39 win–loss record and qualified for the NBA Playoffs.
title: 1977–78 New York Knicks season

text: In the first round of the 1978 Playoffs, New York defeated the Cleveland Cavaliers, 2–0, to advance to the Eastern Conference Semifinals.
title: 1977–78 New York Knicks season

text: There, the Knicks lost to the Philadelphia 76ers in a four-game sweep.
title: 1977–78 New York Knicks season

text: The 2004–05 New York Knicks season was the 59th season for the team in the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: During the offseason, the Knicks acquired Jamal Crawford from the Chicago Bulls.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: Early in the season, the team released Shandon Anderson after he had played one game; Anderson later joined the Miami Heat as a free agent.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks played around .500 with a 16–13 start, but then lost 16 of their next 18 games.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: Head coach Lenny Wilkins resigned after a 17–22 start, and was replaced by assistant Herb Williams for the remainder of the season.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks then lost nine straight games between March and April, finishing fourth place in the Atlantic Division with a 33–49 record, and failing to qualify for the NBA Playoffs.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: In his first full season with the Knicks, Stephon Marbury led the team with 21.7 points, 8.1 assists and 1.5 steals per game.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: Following the season, Larry Brown was hired as coach and Allan Houston retired.
title: 2004–05 New York Knicks season

text: The 1985–86 New York Knicks season was the 40th season of NBA basketball in New York City, New York.
title: 1985–86 New York Knicks season

text: The Knicks had won the first overall pick in the 1985 NBA draft in the league's first ever draft lottery, which they used to select Patrick Ewing out of Georgetown, who was regarded as the most sought-after prospect since Kareem Abdul-Jabbar in 1969 by "The New York Times".
title: 1985–86 New York Knicks season

text: He was signed to a six-year $17 million deal, the richest ever for an NBA rookie.
title: 1985–86 New York Knicks season

text: The Houston Rockets are an American professional basketball team based in Houston, Texas.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: The team plays in the Southwest Division of the Western Conference in National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: The team was established in 1967, and played in San Diego, California for four years before being moved to Houston.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: In the Rockets debut season, they won only 15 games.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: However, after drafting Elvin Hayes first overall in the 1969 NBA Draft, they made their first appearance in the playoffs in 1969.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: After Hayes was traded, Moses Malone was acquired to replace him.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: Malone won two MVPs during his time in Houston, and he led the Rockets to the conference finals in his first year with the team.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: He also took the Rockets to the NBA Finals in 1981, but they were defeated in six games by the Boston Celtics.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: In 1984, the Rockets drafted Hakeem Olajuwon, who led them to the 1986 Finals in his second year, where they lost again to Boston.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: In the next seven seasons, they lost in the first round of the playoffs five times.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: They won their first NBA championship in 1994, led by Olajuwon, who won Finals MVP.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: They repeated as champions the next year, and Olajuwon won Finals MVP once again.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: To date, the Rockets have not advanced to the finals again.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: The Rockets missed the playoffs from 1999–2003, and did not make the playoffs again until after they drafted Yao Ming in 2002.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: Since then, the Rockets have had a winning season in all but two of the next 14 seasons and, led by James Harden, advanced to the conference finals in 2015.
title: Houston Rockets all-time roster

text: Michael Lloyd Miller (born February 19, 1980) is an American professional basketball player who last played for the Denver Nuggets of the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: Mike Miller (basketball player)

text: He played college basketball for the University of Florida, and was selected by the Orlando Magic in the first round of the 2000 NBA draft.
title: Mike Miller (basketball player)

text: He has also played for the Memphis Grizzlies, Minnesota Timberwolves, Washington Wizards and Miami Heat.
title: Mike Miller (basketball player)

text: He was named the NBA Rookie of the Year in 2001, and the NBA Sixth Man of the Year in 2006.
title: Mike Miller (basketball player)

text: Miller won back-to-back NBA championships with the Miami Heat in 2012 and 2013.
title: Mike Miller (basketball player)

text: He is a swingman who is primarily a three-point specialist.
title: Mike Miller (basketball player)

text: Raymond Albert Patterson, Jr. (January 15, 1922 – August 3, 2011) was general manager of the NBA's Houston Rockets from 1972 to 1990.
title: Ray Patterson (basketball)

text: He was named NBA Executive of the Year in 1977, and his Rockets appeared in the NBA Finals in 1981 and 1986.
title: Ray Patterson (basketball)

text: Among his most notable player acquisitions were Ralph Sampson in 1983 and Hakeem Olajuwon in 1984.
title: Ray Patterson (basketball)

text: He left the Rockets in 1990 with hopes of becoming co-owner of an NHL team in Houston, and was succeeded by his son, Steve.
title: Ray Patterson (basketball)

text: Ray Patterson's NHL dreams never materialized, but he helped found an International Hockey League franchise, the Houston Aeros, in 1994.
title: Ray Patterson (basketball)

text: The 2012–13 Houston Rockets season was the 46th season of the franchise in the National Basketball Association (NBA), and the 42nd based in Houston.
title: 2012–13 Houston Rockets season

text: The season is best remembered for acquiring All-Star and Sixth Man of the Year James Harden from the Oklahoma City Thunder in a trade.
title: 2012–13 Houston Rockets season

text: Along with Harden, the team brought in point guard Jeremy Lin after a magical season with the New York Knicks last year and center Omer Asik.
title: 2012–13 Houston Rockets season

text: The 2013 NBA All-Star Game was an exhibition basketball game that was played on February 17, 2013 at Toyota Center in Houston, Texas, the current home of the Houston Rockets.
title: 2013 NBA All-Star Game

text: This game was the 62nd edition of the National Basketball Association (NBA) All-Star Game and was played during the 2012–13 NBA season.
title: 2013 NBA All-Star Game

text: The Houston Rockets were awarded the All-Star Game in an announcement by commissioner David Stern on February 8, 2012.
title: 2013 NBA All-Star Game

text: This was the third time that Houston had hosted the All-Star Game; the city had previously hosted the event in 1989 at the Astrodome and 2006 at the Toyota Center.
title: 2013 NBA All-Star Game

text: The West won the game 143–138, and Chris Paul of the Los Angeles Clippers was named the game's most valuable player (MVP).
title: 2013 NBA All-Star Game

text: NBA Live 18 is a basketball simulation video game developed by EA Tiburon and published by EA Sports.
title: NBA Live 18

text: It features James Harden of the Houston Rockets as its cover athlete, as he is seen in the cover on "The Streets" and on "The League" in his Houston Rockets jersey.
title: NBA Live 18

text: Also, it was released for the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One in North America on September 15, 2017.
title: NBA Live 18

text: The game is the 21st installment of the "NBA Live" series, and the follow-up to 2015's "NBA Live 16" after EA took a year off between games.
title: NBA Live 18

text: Though still receiving some criticism for its gameplay, the game was noted as an improvement over recent installments, and became the highest rated game of the series since "NBA Live 10", according to Metacritic.
title: NBA Live 18

text: Michael Andrew D'Antoni (born May 8, 1951) is an American-Italian professional basketball coach who was formerly a professional basketball player.
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: He is currently the head coach of the Houston Rockets of the National Basketball Association (NBA).
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: While head coach of the NBA's Phoenix Suns, he won NBA Coach of the Year honors for the 2004–05 NBA season after the Suns posted 33 more wins than the previous season.
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: He coached the New York Knicks starting in 2008 before resigning in 2012.
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: He was hired by the Lakers after seven games into the 2012–13 season.
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: D'Antoni, who holds American and Italian dual citizenship, is known for favoring a fast-paced, offense-oriented system.
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: On June 1, 2016, D'Antoni was named as the new head coach for the Houston Rockets.
title: Mike D'Antoni

text: NBA 2K16 is a basketball simulation video game developed by Visual Concepts and published by 2K Sports.

title: NBA 2K16

text: James Edward Harden Jr. (born August 26, 1989) is an American professional basketball player for the Houston Rockets of the National Basketball Association (NBA).

text: The 2000–01 NBA season was the 76ers 52nd season in the National Basketball Association, and 38th season in Philadelphia.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: Allen Iverson had his best season in 2001—he led his team to win their first ten games, he started and won All-Star MVP honors at the All Star Game.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: The Sixers also posted a 56–26 record, which was best in the Eastern Conference that season.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: It was the 76ers' best regular season record since 1984–85.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: Iverson averaged a then-career high 31.1 points, winning his second NBA scoring title in the process.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: He also won the NBA steals title at 2.5 per game.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: Iverson was named NBA Most Valuable Player for his accomplishments, beating Tim Duncan and Shaquille O'Neal by a wide margin.
title: 2000–01 Philadelphia 76ers season

text: In addition, coach Larry Brown was named NBA Coach of the Year, Dikembe Mutombo (who was acquired from the Atlanta Hawks) won his fourth NBA Defensive Player of the Year Award, and Aaron McKie won the NBA Sixth Man of the Year Award.

text: American Airlines Group, Inc. is an American publicly traded airline holding company headquartered in Fort Worth, Texas.
title: American Airlines Group

text: It was formed December 9, 2013, in the merger of AMR Corporation, the parent company of American Airlines, and US Airways Group, the parent company of US Airways.
title: American Airlines Group

text: The airline groups together form the largest airline in the world, with more than 6,700 daily flights to 336 locations in 56 countries worldwide, about $40 billion in operating revenue, over 100,000 employees, and plans to take delivery of 607 new aircraft, including 517 narrowbody aircraft and 90 widebody international aircraft.
title: American Airlines Group

text: The integration of American Airlines and US Airways was completed when the Federal Aviation Administration granted a single operating certificate for both carriers on April 8, 2015.
title: American Airlines Group

text: Suez North America, founded as the Hackensack Water Company in 1869 and later named United Water, is an American water service company headquartered in Paramus, New Jersey.
title: Suez North America

title: Suez North America

title: Suez North America
