title: Suez North America

text: It changed its name to reflect that of its parent company in 2015.
title: Suez North America

text: SM-Chile is a holding company for Banco de Chile.

title: SM-Chile

title: CVS Health

text: The annual Van Buren Popcorn Festival is held each August (it is usually the 1st or 2nd full Thurs, Fri and Sat of August) in Van Buren, Indiana in celebration of the central role of popcorn in the town's identity.

text: As with many small town festivals, Van Buren's focuses on a theme that has meaning to the community.
title: Van Buren Popcorn Festival

title: Van Buren Popcorn Festival

text: Enthusiastic festival goers find a blend of small town charm, yet a summer festival that is big enough to be interesting year after year.
title: Van Buren Popcorn Festival

text: The Saskatchewan Festival of Words Inc. is a registered non-profit organization based in Moose Jaw, Saskatchewan.

text: The iPod click wheel is the navigation component of several iPod models.
title: IPod click wheel

text: It uses a combination of touch technology and traditional buttons, involving the technology of capacitive sensing, which senses the capacitance of the user's fingers.
title: IPod click wheel

text: The wheel allows a user to find music, videos, photos and play games on the device.
title: IPod click wheel

text: The wheel is flush on the face of the iPod and is located below the screen.
title: IPod click wheel

text: The annual Tokyo Summer Festival, organized by the Arion-Edo Foundation in cooperation with Asahi Shimbun, has been thought up in 1985 by Kyoko Edo (pianist), Maki Ishii (composer) and Tashi Funayama (musicologist), who joined hands to plan a truly international music festival in Tokyo at a time when there was no such event in Japan.
title: Tokyo Summer Festival

text: This epoch-making festival is the first in Japan planned and directed by professional musicians.
title: Tokyo Summer Festival

text: The festival takes place under a different theme each year and invites outstanding artists from all around the world in order to let the public discover various styles of music, from classical to world music.
title: Tokyo Summer Festival

text: Many of the participating artists perform for the 1st time in Japan.
title: Tokyo Summer Festival

text: Tropical house, also known as trop house, is a subgenre of deep house, with elements of dancehall and Balearic house.
title: Tropical house

text: Artists of the genre are often featured at various summer festivals such as Tomorrowland.
title: Tropical house

text: The genre was popularized by artists including Thomas Jack, Kygo, Matoma, Lost Frequencies, Seeb and Klingande.
title: Tropical house

text: Snoop Star was a metasearch engine for filesharing networks, with which one could find music and video files in different file sharing networks and download simultaneously.
title: Snoopstar

text: The Dubrovnik Summer Festival (Croatian: "Dubrovačke ljetne igre" ; ] is an annually-held summer festival instituted in 1950 in Dubrovnik, Croatia.
title: Dubrovnik Summer Festival

text: It is held every year between 10 July and 25 August.
title: Dubrovnik Summer Festival

text: Lodewijk Fluttert (born 8 October 1991), best known by his stage name Bakermat, is a Dutch DJ and music producer from the village of Markelo in Overijssel.
title: Bakermat

text: His music consists of a mix of electronic, deep and tropical house, techno music produced in a minimalist manner with jazz and soul influences.
title: Bakermat

text: All That Music and More Festival was a summer festival promotional tour for All That, during June 1999 – August 1999.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: It was hosted by the season 6 cast of All That, and features musical guest, mostly the ones that were on All That.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: During every tour location, The cast have performed live sketchs on stage.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: It was also the first Music Festival for kids.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: It was headlined by the group 98 Degrees.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: The tour happened for a second time during the summer of 2000 and was hosted by Kenan Thompson and Nick Cannon.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: It was headlined by the group LFO and ended on September 3, 2000.
title: All That! Music and More Festival

text: Weekend Festival is a music festival taking place in Helsinki, Pärnu and Sweden.
title: Weekend Festival

text: The festival was organised for the first time in Luukki, Espoo (about 25 km from the centre of Helsinki), Finland on the 17 and 18 of August 2012.
title: Weekend Festival

text: In 2013 the festival location was changed to its current location at Kyläsaari/Kalasatama in Helsinki.
title: Weekend Festival

text: Weekend Festival artist line up has mainly consisted of EDM artists but there have also been artists from other music genres present.
title: Weekend Festival

text: The festival has been attended by more than 40,000 people on both years.
title: Weekend Festival

text: Every year the festival has a different theme which reflects mainly in the visual side of the festival.
title: Weekend Festival

text: In 2013 the festival theme was Space and Future while for 2014 the organisers decided to go with Electro Disco theme.
title: Weekend Festival

text: The festival lineup has featured various internationally acclaimed artists including Skrillex, David Guetta, Calvin Harris etc. and Finland's own popular artists.
title: Weekend Festival

text: Weekend Festival has sold out in advance on both years.
title: Weekend Festival

text: In 2013 Weekend Festival was voted as the best summer festival by the listeners of Finnish radio station YleX.
title: Weekend Festival

text: In 2015, Weekend Festival expanded to Pärnu, Estonia and in 2016 to Sweden
title: Weekend Festival

text: Prozor Fortress (Croatian: "Tvrđava Prozor" or "Gradina" ) is a medieval fortress situated in the continental part of Split-Dalmatia County, in inland Dalmatia, just above the town of Vrlika in Croatia.
title: Prozor Fortress

text: From its origin as a small stronghold built by the ancient Illyrian tribe Dalmatae, it developed into a fortress in the 15th century, during the reign of the Croatian and Bosnian feudal lord Hrvoje Vukčić Hrvatinić.
title: Prozor Fortress

text: Tønsberg Fortress ("Tunsberg festning") was a medieval fortress, located in Tønsberg, Norway which was defended by the fortress for over 300 years.
title: Tønsberg Fortress

text: The Klis Fortress (Croatian: "Tvrđava Klis" ) is a medieval fortress situated above a village bearing the same name, near the city of Split, in central Dalmatia, Croatia.
title: Fortress of Klis

text: From its origin as a small stronghold built by the ancient Illyrian tribe Dalmatae, becoming a royal castle that was the seat of many Croatian kings, to its final development as a large fortress during the Ottoman wars in Europe, Klis Fortress has guarded the frontier, being lost and re-conquered several times throughout its more-than-two-thousand-year-long history.
title: Fortress of Klis

text: Due to its location on a pass that separates the mountains Mosor and Kozjak, the fortress served as a major source of defense in Dalmatia, especially against the Ottoman advance, and has been a key crossroad between the Mediterranean belt and the Balkan rear.
title: Fortress of Klis

text: Glamoč fortress (Bosnian: "Glamočka tvrđava" ) is a medieval fortress located on the north slopes of Staretina mountain just above town of Glamoč.
title: Glamoč Fortress

text: The construction of the fortress started as early as 14th century.
title: Glamoč Fortress

text: Nicopsis, Nikopsis, or Nikopsia (Greek: Νικόψις ; Georgian: ნიკოფსი, ნიკოფსია ) was a medieval fortress and town on the northeastern Black Sea coast, somewhere between the towns of Tuapse, Russia, and New Athos, Abkhazia/Georgia.
title: Nicopsis

text: It features in the medieval Greek and Georgian sources as a Byzantine outpost and then as the northwestern extreme of the Kingdom of Georgia.
title: Nicopsis

text: A center of Christianity in the region known as Zichia, Nikopsis was at times a Byzantine bishopric and was believed to be a burial place of the apostle Simon the Canaanite.
title: Nicopsis

text: Prizren Fortress (Serbian: Призренски град"/Prizrenski grad" ), also known as Kaljaja (Albanian: "Каlаја" , ) and Dušan's Fortress (Душанов град"/Dušanov grad" ), is a medieval fortress in Prizren, Kosovo, which once served as the capital of the Serbian Empire.
title: Prizren Fortress

text: It was built on a hill above Prizrenska Bistrica, around which the modern city developed.
title: Prizren Fortress

text: The first fort, erected on this location by the Byzantines, was further expanded by Emperor Stefan Dušan (r. 1331–55).
title: Prizren Fortress

text: The fort then came under the control of the Ottomans for four centuries.
title: Prizren Fortress

text: It was declared a Monument of Culture of Exceptional Importance in 1948.
title: Prizren Fortress

text: Asen's Fortress (Bulgarian: Асенова крепост , "Asenova krepost"), identified by some researchers as Petrich (Петрич), is a medieval fortress in the Bulgarian Rhodope Mountains, 2 to south of the town of Asenovgrad, on a high rocky ridge on the left bank of the Asenitsa River.
title: Asen's Fortress

text: Asen's Fortress is 279 m above sea level.
title: Asen's Fortress

text: Saranta Kolones(Greek: Κάστρο Σαράντα Κολώνες, Forty Columns castle ) is a ruined medieval fortress inside the Paphos Archaeological Park and it is located just north of the harbour of Paphos, on the island of Cyprus.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: It takes its name from the large number of granite columns that were found on the site and probably once formed part of the ancient agora.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: The Byzantine castle is believed to have been built at the end of the 7th century AD to protect the port and the city of Nea Pafos from Arab raids and later remodeled by the Lusignans.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: The Fortress had a three-metre thick wall with four huge corner towers and another four intermediary towers along the joining walls and moat surrounding the castle.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: Access was across a wooden bridge spanning the moat.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: The square courtyard measured 35 metres long by 35 metres wide, with a tower at each corner.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: The main entrance was through a fifth, horseshoe-shaped tower on the east side.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: Destroyed by an earthquake in 1222, the castle was subsequently abandoned.
title: Saranta Kolones

text: Buncle is a Celtic derived surname originating from Bonkyll Castle, Berwickshire, Scotland.
title: Buncle

text: It has many modern variations that are phonetically similar, for example: Bonkle, Bonkyll, Bonkill, Bonkylle, Bonkile, Bunkle, Bunkall and Bonckle.
title: Buncle

text: The names' meaning is believed to refer to a chapel at the bottom of hill.
title: Buncle

text: Bonkyll Castle (also variously spelled Bonkyl, Boncle, Buncle, Bunkle or Bonkill) was a medieval fortress situated in the eastern Scottish Borders of which little remains.
title: Bonkyll Castle

text: The site is protected as a scheduled monument.
title: Bonkyll Castle

text: The Mazda RX-9 is a sports car produced by the Japanese automaker Mazda scheduled for release in 2020.
title: Mazda RX-9

text: "Holiday Auto", a Japanese magazine, reported it will be previewed at the 2017 Tokyo Auto Show, and the final production model will be featured at the same event in 2019.
title: Mazda RX-9

text: The car will be released in January 2020, to coincide with Mazda's 100th anniversary, and will be initially priced at eight million yen (US$(8000000/ 105.944781 )round0 in 2015).
title: Mazda RX-9

text: It is believed it will showcase the return of the Wankel rotary engine, but CEO Masamichi Kogai said Mazda will not launch another rotary engine.
title: Mazda RX-9

text: In the middle of the September 2017, Mazda has filed a patent application for an engine that uses two conventional turbochargers and an electric supercharger.
title: Mazda RX-9

text: The engine looks compact, can replace the rotary engine and possibly be included in RX-9 production.
title: Mazda RX-9

text: The Mazda 929 is a full-size car which was sold by the Japanese automobile manufacturer Mazda between 1973 and 1997.
title: Mazda 929

text: Mazda utilized the 929 nameplate for export markets only, badge engineering its Luce model until 1991 and then transferring the name to export specification Sentia models.
title: Mazda 929

text: Between 1982 and 1986, Mazda also used the 929 nameplate for its Cosmo coupe in certain export markets.
title: Mazda 929

text: The Mazda Takeri was a concept car made by Mazda.
title: Mazda Takeri

text: It was a preview to the next generation Mazda6.
title: Mazda Takeri

text: The Mazda GTP is an IMSA GTP car that was built by Pierre Honegger in 1981.
title: Mazda GTP

text: Based on a Mazda RX-7, the car initially competed in the GTX category as the Mazda RX-7 GTP, before it was rebuilt for the IMSA GTP category in 1983.
title: Mazda GTP

text: Throughout its career, the car used a Mazda 13B Wankel rotary engine, similar to that used in the production RX-7s.
title: Mazda GTP

text: Although the rotary-engined sports prototypes generally had a reputation of being very reliable, the Mazda GTP frequently failed to finish races, and was never able to better the eighth place achieved at the 1983 24 Hours of Daytona.
title: Mazda GTP

text: In 1986, one car was purchased by Erie Scientific Racing, and rebuilt to become the Badger BB.
title: Mazda GTP

text: This car was no more successful or reliable than its predecessor, and was last used in 1989, by which point it was owned by Jack Engelhardt.
title: Mazda GTP

text: The other car, meanwhile, was rebuilt by Honegger into the Denali Speedcar, which was used with moderate success in 1986 and 1987.
title: Mazda GTP

text: The Mazda Taiki is a one-off concept car produced by Mazda, and is the fourth car in Mazda's 'Nagare' design series.
title: Mazda Taiki

text: Mazda says the Taiki "reflects one possible direction for a future generation of Mazda sports cars aimed at helping to create a sustainable society".
title: Mazda Taiki

text: The Nissan Altima (Japanese: 日産・アルティマ ) is a mid-size car which has been manufactured by Nissan since 1992.
title: Nissan Altima

text: It is a continuation of the Nissan Bluebird line, which began in 1957.
title: Nissan Altima

text: The Nissan Altima mainly competes against cars such as Chevrolet's Malibu, Ford's Fusion, Honda's Accord, Hyundai's Sonata, Mazda's Mazda6, Subaru's Legacy, Kia's Optima, Toyota's Camry and Volkswagen's Passat.
title: Nissan Altima

text: The Mazda Hakaze Concept is a concept car that was revealed in early February 2007 by Japanese manufacturer Mazda.
title: Mazda Hakaze Concept

text: Its major design elements come from a new design language developed by Mazda called Nagare, developed by Laurens van den Acker, Mazda Global Design Director.
title: Mazda Hakaze Concept

text: It translates to "flow".
title: Mazda Hakaze Concept

text: This element has been used on past Mazda concept cars such as: Mazda Nagare; Mazda Ryuga; Mazda Kabura.
title: Mazda Hakaze Concept

text: The Mazda Kazamai is a concept car made by the Japanese car manufacturer Mazda.
title: Mazda Kazamai

text: It was first introduced at the 2008 Moscow International Motor Show in August.
title: Mazda Kazamai

text: The Mazda 6 or Mazda6 (known as the Mazda Atenza in China and Japan, derived from the Italian "attenzione") is a Midsize family produced by the Japanese car manufacturer Mazda since 2002.
title: Mazda6

text: It replaced the long-produced Mazda Capella (616, 626) in 2002.
title: Mazda6

text: The Mazda6 sold more than one million units faster than all previous Mazdas.
title: Mazda6

text: Bahman Group (Persian: ‎ ‎ ) is an Iran-based manufacturer of vehicles under license by Mazda.
title: Bahman Group

text: Bahman Group was founded in 1952 under the title of Iran Khalij Co by Mr. Amanollah Sarbaz and his son.
title: Bahman Group

text: They have since then manufactured, under license, versions of Mazda's trucks, including versions of the Mazda B-Series pickups and the previous generation Mazda 323 and Mazda 3.
title: Bahman Group

text: They also manufacture Isuzu buses and FAW trucks.
title: Bahman Group

text: Currently, the group is headed by Mohammad Reza Soroush.
title: Bahman Group

text: Madonna of the Trail is a series of 12 monuments dedicated to the spirit of pioneer women in the United States.
title: Madonna of the Trail

text: The monuments were commissioned by the National Society of Daughters of the American Revolution (NSDAR).
title: Madonna of the Trail

text: They were installed in each of the 12 states along the National Old Trails Road, which extended from Cumberland, Maryland, to Upland, California.
title: Madonna of the Trail

text: National Old Trails Road, also known as the Ocean-to-Ocean Highway, was established in 1912, and became part of the National Auto Trail system in the United States.
title: National Old Trails Road

text: It was 3096 mi long and stretched from Baltimore, Maryland (some old maps indicate New York City was the actual eastern terminus), to California.
title: National Old Trails Road

text: Much of the route follows the old National Road and the Santa Fe Trail.
title: National Old Trails Road

text: The National Monument to the U.S. Constitution (also known as the Constitution Bicentennial Monument) is a monument commissioned of Australian artist Brett-Livingstone Strong by Warren E. Burger, Chairman of the Commission on the Bicentennial of the United States Constitution, to commemorate the 200th anniversary of the signing of the United States Constitution.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: One of a pair created by Strong to commemorate historic anniversaries, along with The United States Presidency Monument, it was dedicated by President Ronald Reagan at Independence Hall in Philadelphia on September 17, 1987.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: Both monuments are the property of the Global EventMakers,Inc., a Florida-based company with principal offices in Richmond, Virginia.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: The monument has been transported for display at several public events around the country and was scheduled to begin a twenty-city traveling exhibit as part of the Spirit of Freedom Tour beginning in September 2009.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: Due to poor economic conditions, The Tour never commenced; however the Monuments accompanying original replicas of the United States Constitution and Bill of Rights are being produced for placement in America's schools.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: All rights to the Constitution Monument and the Original Replicas of the Constitution were transferred to The American Constitution Spirit Foundation, a Virginia non-profit, in March 2010.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: The Foundation plans to find a permanent home for the monument during 2013.
title: National Monument to the U.S. Constitution

text: Edward Norton Hamilton, Jr. (born February 14, 1947) is an American sculptor living in Louisville, Kentucky, who specializes in public art.
title: Ed Hamilton

text: His most famous work is "The Spirit of Freedom", a memorial to black Civil War veterans, that stands in Washington, DC, in the Shaw neighborhood near Howard University.
title: Ed Hamilton

text: Hamilton has also created monuments dedicated to Booker T. Washington, Joe Louis, York (William Clark's manservant on the Lewis and Clark Expedition), and the slaves who revolted on "La Amistad".
title: Ed Hamilton

text: The William Penn Highway was an auto trail in the United States, generally running from Pittsburgh east to New York City.
title: William Penn Highway

text: It served as the eastern end of the Pikes Peak Ocean-to-Ocean Highway.
title: William Penn Highway

text: The William Penn Highway Association of Pennsylvania was organized March 27, 1916 to promote a road parallel to the Pennsylvania Railroad between Pittsburgh and Philadelphia.
title: William Penn Highway

text: Two branches were included — one from Lemoyne (near Harrisburg) to Washington via Baltimore and one from Reading to New York.
title: William Penn Highway

text: The National Pioneer Women's Hall of Fame is a museum located in the former Alice Springs Gaol in Alice Springs, Northern Territory, Australia.
title: National Pioneer Women's Hall of Fame

text: It aims to recognise the place of women in history, and particularly the role of women in Australia's development.
title: National Pioneer Women's Hall of Fame

text: It recognises "any woman who is a pioneer in her chosen field from settlement to present day".
title: National Pioneer Women's Hall of Fame

text: The Pioneer Women's Memorial Garden in Adelaide, Australia, is a tribute to the pioneer women of South Australia.
title: Pioneer Women's Memorial Garden (Adelaide)

text: The garden was designed by landscape designer Elsie Cornish (1887-1946), and the statue created by Ola Cohn was unveiled by Lady Muriel Barclay-Harvey (the wife of the Governor of South Australia, Sir Malcolm Barclay-Harvey) on 19 April 1941.
title: Pioneer Women's Memorial Garden (Adelaide)

text: The Ocean To Ocean Bridge is a through truss bridge spanning the Colorado River in Yuma, Arizona.
title: Ocean To Ocean Bridge

text: Built in 1915, it was the first highway crossing of the lower Colorado and is the earliest example of a through truss bridge in Arizona.
title: Ocean To Ocean Bridge

text: It is also the only example of a Pennsylvania truss within Arizona.
title: Ocean To Ocean Bridge

text: Originally the bridge carried the transcontinental Ocean-to-Ocean Highway and later carried its successor, US 80 until a new bridge was built to the west in 1956.
title: Ocean To Ocean Bridge

text: Between 1988 and 2001, the bridge was closed to vehicular traffic and only traversable by pedestrians and bicyclists.
title: Ocean To Ocean Bridge

text: After a major restoration, the bridge was rehabilitated and reopened to vehicular traffic in 2002, with a re-dedication by the Quechan nation and Yuma Crossing National Heritage Area.
title: Ocean To Ocean Bridge

text: The Highway of Tears murders is a series of murders and disappearances of mainly aboriginal women along the 720 km (450 mi) section of Highway 16 between Prince George and Prince Rupert, British Columbia, Canada from 1969 until 2011.
title: Highway of Tears murders

text: Highway 16 is northern British Columbia's east-west corridor, extending from Jasper in the east to Prince Rupert in the west.
title: Highway of Tears murders

text: This route is a section of the Trans-Canada Yellowhead Highway, also known as the "Park-to-Park Highway", which spans across British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and Manitoba.
title: Highway of Tears murders

text: There are numerous municipalities and twenty-three First Nations communities that border the Highway of Tears.
title: Highway of Tears murders

text: The region is plagued with poverty and lack of public transportation, forcing its occupants to turn to hitchhiking as a form of transit.
title: Highway of Tears murders

text: Police list the number of Highway 16 victims at nineteen, but estimates by aboriginal organizations range into the forties, largely because they include women who disappeared a greater distance from the highway.
title: Highway of Tears murders

text: U.S. Route 80 (US 80) also known as the Ocean-to-Ocean Highway was a major transcontinental highway which existed in the U.S. state of Arizona from November 11, 1926, to October 6, 1989.
title: U.S. Route 80 in Arizona

text: At its peak, US 80 traveled from the California border in Yuma to the New Mexico state line near Lordsburg.
title: U.S. Route 80 in Arizona

text: Locals often used US 80 to reach the beaches around San Diego during the hot Arizona summers.
title: U.S. Route 80 in Arizona

text: US 80 was a particularly long highway, reaching almost 500 mi long within the state of Arizona alone.
title: U.S. Route 80 in Arizona

text: With the advent of the Interstate Highway System, Interstate 10 and Interstate 8 both replaced US 80 within the state.
title: U.S. Route 80 in Arizona

text: US 80 was removed from Arizona in 1989; the remainder of it now being State Route 80.
title: U.S. Route 80 in Arizona

text: The D.C. Armor was a professional indoor football team that began play in the American Indoor Football Association (AIFA) in the 2009 season.
title: D.C. Armor

text: The team was based in Washington, D.C., with home games at the under-renovation D.C. Armory.
title: D.C. Armor

text: The Armor were the first professional football team to play within the District of Columbia since the Washington Redskins left for FedExField in 1997.
title: D.C. Armor

text: The Armor was also the area's first indoor football team since the Washington Commandos played in the Arena Football League in 1990, and the only arena/indoor football team to play within the district (the Commandos played in the Capital Centre and the Patriot Center).
title: D.C. Armor

text: After one, poorly attended season, the Armor folded.
title: D.C. Armor

text: The England women's national under-23 football team, also known as England women Under-23s or England women U23(s), is a youth association football team operated under the auspices of The Football Association.
title: England women's national under-23 football team

text: Its primary role is the development of players in preparation for the senior England women's national football team.
title: England women's national under-23 football team

text: As long as they are eligible, players can play for England at any level, making it possible to play for the U23s, senior side, and again for the U23s, as Natasha Dowie, Rachel Williams and Danielle Buet have done recently.
title: England women's national under-23 football team

text: In 2005 Casey Stoney played for the team in the Nordic Cup, despite already having 30 caps at senior level.
title: England women's national under-23 football team

text: It is also possible to play for one country at youth level and another at senior level (providing the player is eligible).
title: England women's national under-23 football team

text: Helen Lander and Kylie Davies decided to play for Wales at senior level after playing for England U23s, while Sophie Perry elected to play for Ireland.
title: England women's national under-23 football team

text: The Kentucky Xtreme were a professional indoor football team based in Louisville, Kentucky, which had its operations suspended by the Continental Indoor Football League (CIFL) midway through the 2014 CIFL season.
title: Kentucky Xtreme

text: The team was a member of the South Division of the CIFL after starting in 2013 as an expansion team.
title: Kentucky Xtreme

text: The Xtreme were the first indoor football team in the Louisville area since the Louisville Fire, a member of af2, folded in 2008.
title: Kentucky Xtreme

text: The co-owners of the Xtreme are Victor Cole and Mario Urrutia.
title: Kentucky Xtreme

text: The Xtreme played their home games at Freedom Hall in Louisville, but was suspended by the league when Urrutia abandoned the team to join the Winnipeg Blue Bombers midseason.
title: Kentucky Xtreme

text: Robert Patrick ("Tate") Forcier (born August 7, 1990) is a former American football quarterback.
title: Tate Forcier

text: He was a starting quarterback for the 2009 Michigan Wolverines football team ahead of Denard Robinson, and Robinson's back up for the 2010 Michigan Wolverines football team before he lost the starting job and left the program in January 2011 when head coach Rich Rodriguez was replaced by Brady Hoke.
title: Tate Forcier

text: He missed the January 1, 2011 Gator Bowl after being ruled academically ineligible and was no longer enrolled at the university when the new term began following the semester break.
title: Tate Forcier

text: On February 9, 2011, Forcier announced his transfer to the University of Miami.
title: Tate Forcier

text: He originally intended to redshirt the 2011 season and play for the Miami Hurricanes football team in the 2012 and 2013 season but instead transferred to San Jose State University to play for the Spartans football team.
title: Tate Forcier

text: He soon withdrew from the San Jose State football program.
title: Tate Forcier

text: He then attended training camp with the Hamilton Tiger-Cats of the Canadian Football League.
title: Tate Forcier

text: Willie Martinez (born February 21, 1963) is an American football coach.
title: Willie Martinez (American football)

text: He was the defensive backs coach for the University of Tennessee.
title: Willie Martinez (American football)

text: A graduate of the University of Miami, Martinez was formerly defensive coordinator and secondary coach of the Georgia Bulldogs football team, initially working as the secondary coach from 2001 to 2005 before being promoted to defensive coordinator.
title: Willie Martinez (American football)

text: He was fired following the 2009 season.
title: Willie Martinez (American football)

text: The 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season was the 114th season in the club's history and the 48th consecutive season in the top flight of German football, the Bundesliga, since the promotion of the team from the Regionalliga Süd in 1965.
title: 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season

text: Before the start of the season, Bayern signed Xherdan Shaqiri, Dante, Claudio Pizarro, Mitchell Weiser, Tom Starke and Mario Mandžukić.
title: 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season

text: Bayern also added holding midfielder Javi Martínez after the first week of the Bundesliga season at the transfer deadline.
title: 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season

text: The club started the season with a nine-match winning streak.
title: 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season

text: The club would end the season claiming the Treble, winning the Bundesliga, the UEFA Champions League and the DFB-Pokal.
title: 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season

text: Bayern are the first German club to achieve the Treble and are the third European Club to complete the Treble in the last five seasons and seventh ever in European Club competition.
title: 2012–13 FC Bayern Munich season

text: The 2012 FIU Panthers football team represented Florida International University during the 2012 NCAA Division I FBS football season.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: They were led by sixth year head coach Mario Cristobal and played their home games at FIU Stadium.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: They were a member of the Sun Belt Conference.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: This was the Panthers final season as members of the Sun Belt as they have accepted an invitation to join Conference USA on July 1, 2013.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: They were a member of the Sun Belt Conference.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: They finished the season 3–9, 2–6 in Sun Belt play to finish in a tie for eighth place.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: Head coach Mario Cristobal was fired at the end of the season after posting a 27–47 record in six seasons.
title: 2012 FIU Panthers football team

text: Javier "Javi" Martínez Aginaga (] ; born 2 September 1988) is a Spanish footballer who plays for German club FC Bayern Munich as a defensive midfielder or a central defender.
title: Javi Martínez

text: Mario Gómez García (] ; born 10 July 1985) is a German professional footballer who plays as a striker for Bundesliga club VfL Wolfsburg and the Germany national team.
title: Mario Gómez

text: Gómez joined Fiorentina after spending four seasons with Bayern Munich, which he joined after six years playing for VfB Stuttgart.
title: Mario Gómez

text: At the time the fee was a record for a player transferred in the Bundesliga, estimated to be €30–35 million.
title: Mario Gómez

text: The fee is currently the third highest, after former Bayern teammates Mario Götze and Javi Martínez, respectively.
title: Mario Gómez

text: When Stuttgart became champions in 2006–07, Gómez contributed 14 goals and 7 assists at age 21 and was selected as German Footballer of the Year.
title: Mario Gómez

text: The 1993 Auburn Tigers football team represented Auburn University in the 1993 NCAA Division I-A football season.
title: 1993 Auburn Tigers football team

text: Under first-year head coach Terry Bowden, the team went undefeated with a record of 11–0 and finished #4 in the AP Poll.
title: 1993 Auburn Tigers football team

text: Due to NCAA probation, Auburn was banned from TV and post-season play, and suffered reduced scholarships.
title: 1993 Auburn Tigers football team

text: The post-season ban prevented Auburn from playing the SEC Championship and a bowl game.
title: 1993 Auburn Tigers football team

text: Nonetheless, Auburn was the only major college football team to finish the season undefeated.
title: 1993 Auburn Tigers football team

text: The National Champions Foundation recognized Auburn as one of its 1993 national champions, however Auburn University only formally recognizes championships for the 1957 Auburn Tigers football team and 2010 Auburn Tigers football team seasons, although the official website for Auburn athletics does highlight the 1993 team.
title: 1993 Auburn Tigers football team

text: Boone's Cave Park is a 110-acre county park located near Lexington, North Carolina It was established in 1909 by the Daniel Boone Memorial Association.
title: Boone's Cave Park

text: It is named after American pioneer Daniel Boone.
title: Boone's Cave Park

text: Ballentine-Shealy House, also known as the Ballentine-Shealy-Slocum House, is a historic home located near Lexington, Lexington County, South Carolina.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: It was built in the late-18th or early-19th century, and is a 1 1/2-story, rectangular log building.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: It is sheathed in weatherboard and has a standing seam metal gable roof.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: It has shed rooms on the rear and a one-story shed-roofed front porch with an enclosed room.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: The house has a hall-and-parlor plan and an enclosed stair.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: An open breezeway connects the house to the kitchen (ca. 1870), which has a fieldstone and brick chimney and a side porch.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: Also on the property a dilapidated dairy, a small log barn, and a well house.
title: Ballentine-Shealy House

text: Daniel Boone (November 2, 1734 [O.S. October 22] September 26, 1820) was an American pioneer, explorer, woodsman, and frontiersman, whose frontier exploits made him one of the first folk heroes of the United States.
title: Daniel Boone

text: Boone is most famous for his exploration and settlement of what is now Kentucky, which was then part of Virginia but on the other side of the mountains from the settled areas.
title: Daniel Boone

text: As a young adult, Boone supplemented his farm income by hunting and trapping game, and selling their pelts in the fur market.
title: Daniel Boone

text: Through this occupational interest, Boone first learned the easy routes to the area.
title: Daniel Boone

text: Despite some resistance from American Indian tribes such as the Shawnee, in 1775, Boone blazed his Wilderness Road through the Cumberland Gap in the Appalachian Mountains from North Carolina and Tennessee into Kentucky.
title: Daniel Boone

text: There, he founded the village of Boonesborough, Kentucky, one of the first American settlements west of the Appalachians.
title: Daniel Boone

text: Before the end of the 18th century, more than 200,000 Americans migrated to Kentucky/Virginia by following the route marked by Boone.
title: Daniel Boone

text: Pilgrim Reformed Church Cemetery is a historic church cemetery located near Lexington, Davidson County, North Carolina.
title: Pilgrim Reformed Church Cemetery

text: It is associated with the Pilgrim Reformed Church, founded about 1757 By a man of the name Valentine Leonhardt.
title: Pilgrim Reformed Church Cemetery

text: It contains approximately 350 burials, with the earliest gravestone dated to 1781.
title: Pilgrim Reformed Church Cemetery

text: It features a unique collection of folk gravestones by local stone cutters erected in Davidson County in the late-18th and first half of the 19th centuries.
title: Pilgrim Reformed Church Cemetery

text: The church was the first Pilgrim church in North Carolina.
title: Pilgrim Reformed Church Cemetery

text: Maj. Henry A. Meetze House is a historic home located near Lexington, Lexington County, South Carolina.
title: Maj. Henry A. Meetze House

text: It was built about 1855, and consists of a two-story, rectangular main block, with one-story side wings and a rear ell.
title: Maj. Henry A. Meetze House

text: The vernacular Italianate dwelling features a hipped roof with bracketed eaves, one and two-story porticoes with cast iron decoration, and bay windows.
title: Maj. Henry A. Meetze House

text: Also on the property is the original wellhouse and several sheds.
title: Maj. Henry A. Meetze House

text: Henry Meetze (1820-1904) was a prominent attorney, businessman and civic leader in the Lexington area.
title: Maj. Henry A. Meetze House

text: North Davidson Senior High School (commonly referred to as "North Davidson," "NDHS," or simply "North") is a public high school in Welcome, North Carolina (near Lexington).
title: North Davidson High School

text: It was established in 1952 and is located along Old US Highway 52 in northern Davidson County.
title: North Davidson High School

text: The high school serves the Welcome, Arcadia and Midway areas.
title: North Davidson High School

text: Maryland Route 237 (MD 237) is a state highway in the U.S. state of Maryland.
title: Maryland Route 237

text: Known as Chancellors Run Road, the route runs 2.95 mi from MD 246 near Lexington Park north to MD 235 in California.
title: Maryland Route 237

text: MD 237, which was designated in the mid-1980s, bypasses the center of Lexington Park through the suburban area surrounding Naval Air Station Patuxent River (NAS Patuxent River).
title: Maryland Route 237

text: The state highway was expanded to a four-lane divided highway between 2008 and 2010 in response to increased activity at the military base.
title: Maryland Route 237

text: Hedrick's Grove Reformed Church, also known as Hedrick's Grove United Church of Christ, is a historic Reformed church located near Lexington, Davidson County, North Carolina.
title: Hedrick's Grove Reformed Church

text: It was built in 1921-1922, and is a large Romanesque Revival style brick structure.
title: Hedrick's Grove Reformed Church

text: It features a pair of corner towers of uneven height joined by a central arcaded loggia.
title: Hedrick's Grove Reformed Church

text: Also on the property is a contributing church cemetery with approximately 375 graves.
title: Hedrick's Grove Reformed Church

text: Kentucky Horse Park is a working horse farm and an educational theme park opened in 1978 in Lexington, Kentucky.
title: Kentucky Horse Park

text: It is located off Kentucky State Highway 1973 (Iron Works Pike) and Interstate 75, at Exit 120, in northern Fayette County in the United States.
title: Kentucky Horse Park

text: The equestrian facility is a 1224 acre park dedicated to "man's relationship with the horse."
title: Kentucky Horse Park

text: Open to the public, the park has a twice daily Horses of the World Show, showcasing both common and rare horses from around the globe.
title: Kentucky Horse Park

text: The horses are ridden in authentic costume.
title: Kentucky Horse Park

text: Each year the park is host to a number of special events and horse shows.
title: Kentucky Horse Park

text: Henry Shoaf Farm was a historic farm complex located near Lexington, Davidson County, North Carolina.
title: Henry Shoaf Farm

text: The complex included a two-story log house with an Italianate style addition built about 1860, double pen log barn dated to 1811, smokehouse, corn crib, granary, and potato house.
title: Henry Shoaf Farm

text: It has been demolished.
title: Henry Shoaf Farm

text: Red Alert is a 1958 novel by Peter George about nuclear war.
title: Red Alert (novel)

text: The book was the underlying inspiration for Stanley Kubrick's 1964 film "Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb".
title: Red Alert (novel)

text: Kubrick's film differs significantly from the novel in that it is a black comedy.
title: Red Alert (novel)

text: The Magic Christian is a 1959 comic novel by American author Terry Southern (1924–1995) about an odd billionaire who spends most of his time playing elaborate practical jokes on people.
title: The Magic Christian (novel)

text: It is known for bringing Southern to the attention of filmmaker Stanley Kubrick, who had received a copy as a gift from Peter Sellers, and subsequently hired him as co-writer for "Dr. Strangelove" (1964) when Kubrick decided to make that film a black comedy/satire, rather than a straightforward thriller.
title: The Magic Christian (novel)

text: In 1969, "The Magic Christian" was made into a film starring Peter Sellers and Ringo Starr; the story was much altered and relocated from New York City to London.
title: The Magic Christian (novel)

text: Hawk Films was a British film production company formed by Stanley Kubrick for his 1964 film "Dr. Strangelove".
title: Hawk Films

text: He also used it as production company for "A Clockwork Orange" (1971), "Barry Lyndon" (1975), "The Shining" (1980) and "Full Metal Jacket" (1987).
title: Hawk Films

text: Lewis Sayre Schwartz (July 24, 1926 – June 18, 2011) was an American comic book artist, advertising creator and filmmaker, credited as a ghost artist for Bob Kane on DC Comics "Batman" from 1946-47 through 1953, and with writer David Vern Reed, as co-creator of the villain Deadshot.
title: Lew Schwartz

text: Alongside Pablo Ferro and Fred Mogubgub, he was cofounder of Ferro, Mogubgub and Schwartz in 1961, a film company whose work includes the credits to Stanley Kubrick's "Dr. Strangelove".
title: Lew Schwartz

text: Schwartz was a teacher at the School of Visual Arts during the early 1960s.
title: Lew Schwartz

text: He produced a film about Milton Caniff in 1981.
title: Lew Schwartz

text: Louis Burton Lindley Jr. (June 29, 1919December 8, 1983), better known by his stage name Slim Pickens, was an American rodeo performer and film and television actor.
title: Slim Pickens

text: During much of his career, Pickens played mainly cowboy roles, and is perhaps best remembered today for his comic roles in "Dr. Strangelove" and "Blazing Saddles".
title: Slim Pickens

text: Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb, more commonly known as Dr. Strangelove, is a 1964 political satire black comedy film that satirizes the Cold War fears of a nuclear conflict between the Soviet Union and the United States.
title: Dr. Strangelove

text: The film was directed, produced, and co-written by Stanley Kubrick, stars Peter Sellers and George C. Scott, and features Sterling Hayden, Keenan Wynn, and Slim Pickens.
title: Dr. Strangelove

text: Production took place in the United Kingdom.
title: Dr. Strangelove

text: The film is loosely based on Peter George's thriller novel "Red Alert" (1958).
title: Dr. Strangelove

text: Herman Kahn (February 15, 1922 – July 7, 1983) was a founder of the Hudson Institute and one of the preeminent futurists of the latter part of the twentieth century.
title: Herman Kahn

text: He originally came to prominence as a military strategist and systems theorist while employed at the RAND Corporation.
title: Herman Kahn

text: He became known for analyzing the likely consequences of nuclear war and recommending ways to improve survivability, making him one of three historical inspirations for the title character of Stanley Kubrick's classic black comedy film satire "Dr. Strangelove".
title: Herman Kahn

text: George Campbell Scott (October 18, 1927 – September 22, 1999) was an American stage and film actor, director, and producer.
title: George C. Scott

text: He was best known for his stage work, as well as his portrayal of General George S. Patton in the film "Patton", as General Buck Turgidson in Stanley Kubrick's "Dr. Strangelove or: How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love the Bomb", and as Ebenezer Scrooge in Clive Donner's 1984 film "A Christmas Carol".
title: George C. Scott

text: Benn F. Reyes (b San Francisco 1915 - d. Stockholm Sweden 1968) was an American publicist and impresario mainly known for his work in movies.
title: Benn F. Reyes

text: Reyes' best-known ventures in the this field were his collaborations with American director Stanley Kubrick, including the films "Lolita" "Dr. Strangelove" and "".
title: Benn F. Reyes

text: American actor James Earl Jones has had an extensive career in film, television, and theatre.
title: List of James Earl Jones performances

text: He started out in film by appearing in the 1964 political satire film "Dr. Strangelove" as Lt. Lothar Zogg.
title: List of James Earl Jones performances

text: He then went on to star in the 1970 film "The Great White Hope" as Jack Jefferson, a role he first played in the Broadway production of the same name.
title: List of James Earl Jones performances

text: The film role earned him two Golden Globe nominations, one for Best Actor and winning one for New Star of the Year.
title: List of James Earl Jones performances

text: He also received an Academy Award nomination for Best Actor.
title: List of James Earl Jones performances

text: His other work in the 1970s included playing the title character in "Malcolm X" (1972), Johnny Williams in "The River Niger" (1976), Nick Debrett in "Swashbuckler" (1976), and Malcolm X again in "The Greatest" (1977).
title: List of James Earl Jones performances

text: Samuel Joel "Zero" Mostel (February 28, 1915 – September 8, 1977) was an American actor and comedian of stage and screen, best known for his portrayal of comic characters such as Tevye on stage in "Fiddler on the Roof", Pseudolus on stage and on screen in "A Funny Thing Happened on the Way to the Forum", and Max Bialystock in the original film version of "The Producers".
title: Zero Mostel

text: Mostel was a student of Don Richardson, using an acting technique based on muscle memory.
title: Zero Mostel

text: He was blacklisted during the 1950s, and his testimony before the House Un-American Activities Committee was well-publicized.
title: Zero Mostel

text: He was an Obie Award and three-time Tony Award winner.
title: Zero Mostel

text: National Ethiopian Art Theatre, Inc., was an American thespian company devoted to training, showcasing, and employing black American actors during the Harlem Renaissance.
title: National Ethiopian Art Theatre, Inc.

text: The company was founded by Mrs. Anne Wolter on March 17, 1924, in New York City.
title: National Ethiopian Art Theatre, Inc.

text: The Ethiopian Art Theatre School was its educational arm.
title: National Ethiopian Art Theatre, Inc.

text: Bert Andrews (March 21, 1929–January 25, 1993) was an American photographer, who chronicled black theatre in New York City.
title: Bert Andrews (photographer)

text: In a career that spanned over three decades he photographed many of the leading African American actors of the stage and screen including James Earl Jones, Cicely Tyson, Diana Sands, Louis Gossett, Jr., Billy Dee Williams, Morgan Freeman, Alfre Woodard, Denzel Washington and Samuel L. Jackson.
title: Bert Andrews (photographer)

text: Christopher Nicholas Sarantakos (born December 19, 1967), known by the stage name Criss Angel, is an American magician, illusionist and musician.
title: Criss Angel

text: Angel began his career in New York City, before moving his base of operations to the Las Vegas Valley.
title: Criss Angel

text: He is known for starring in the television and stage show "Criss Angel Mindfreak" and his previous live performance illusion show "Criss Angel Believe" in collaboration with "Cirque du Soleil" at the Luxor casino in Las Vegas.
title: Criss Angel

text: The show generated $150 million in tourist revenue to Las Vegas in 2010, but has since been replaced by "Mindfreak LIVE" on 11 May 2016 (the show is partly produced by Cirque, however the directive rights are entirely with Criss Angel).
title: Criss Angel

text: He also starred in the television series "Criss Angel BeLIEve" on Spike TV, the reality-competition television show "Phenomenon" on NBC, and the 2014 stage show "Criss Angel Magicjam".
title: Criss Angel

text: Cheeyang Ng (), also known as Zhiyang, is a singer, actor and dancer currently based in New York City.
title: Ng Chee Yang

text: Born and raised in Singapore, he graduated from Berklee College of Music and is pursuing musical theatre in New York, and a member of the American Actors' Equity Association.
title: Ng Chee Yang

text: Negro Actors Guild of America (NAG) was formed in 1936 and began operation in 1937 to create better opportunities for black actors during a period in America where the country was at a crossroads regarding how its citizens of color would be depicted in film, television and the stage.
title: Negro Actors Guild of America

text: It originated in New York City, post the Great Depression during the height of the Harlem Renaissance, and the NAG sought to eliminate stereotyping of African Americans in theatrical and cinematic performances.
title: Negro Actors Guild of America

text: Organizations to benefit the black actor had been formed well previously though the NAG brought itself to be the first in the United States of such organization to receive state incorporation.
title: Negro Actors Guild of America

text: The NAG stressed in its formal articles within the Certificate of Incorporation the need for more realistic roles for people of color, helped foster the skills of African American actors, and worked to generate more acting opportunities for blacks.
title: Negro Actors Guild of America

text: Matt Levine (born February 17, 1982) is an American entrepreneur and restaurateur known for his ventures in branding and hospitality.
title: Matt Levine

text: Matt Levine is the owner of SoHo market to table restaurant, Chalk Point Kitchen and classic cocktail lounge and piano bar The Handy Liquor Bar, Levine owns a leading downtown New York City inspired food and beverage company, indieFORK.
title: Matt Levine

text: Known as one of the forerunners of New York City progression, Matt Levine has led some of the most popular restaurants in Manhattan to success over the last decade.
title: Matt Levine

text: Previously, Levine was the owner of the Lower East Side Manhattan lounge, The Eldridge, and creator of Steelo', a high-end men's clothing collection.
title: Matt Levine

text: Levine's hospitality portfolio also includes NYC restaurant Sons of Essex.
title: Matt Levine

text: Acclaimed Food & Beverage website Culintro praised Levine commenting “Levine’s restaurants are high-profile and highly creative in both concept and execution.”
title: Matt Levine

text: His other venture, Brandsway Creative, is a branding & marketing firm based out of Manhattan, New York.
title: Matt Levine

text: The Angel Levine is a 1970 American film directed by Jan Kadar and based on a short story by Bernard Malamud about an impoverished New York City tailor (played by Zero Mostel) unable to work due to health problems, creating a financial strain since his wife (Ida Kaminska) is seriously ill.
title: The Angel Levine

text: The tailor's faith is challenged when a man calling himself Alexander Levine (Harry Belafonte) comes into his life, claiming to be his guardian angel.
title: The Angel Levine

text: The angel is concerned that he must make the tailor believe in his mission, or else he will be unable to earn his angelic wings.
title: The Angel Levine

text: First Folio Theatre is a not-for-profit theater company affiliated with the Actors' Equity Association.
title: First Folio Theatre

text: Founded in 1996, First Folio, originally named First Folio Shakespeare Festival, is located on the grounds of the Mayslake Peabody Estate in Oak Brook, Illinois, United States.
title: First Folio Theatre

text: First Folio utilizes the "Folio Method" as developed by Patrick Tucker (at one time of the Royal Shakespeare Company), who first introduced his approach to American actors, directors and teachers in a series of workshops sponsored by the Riverside Shakespeare Company of New York City at The Shakespeare Center beginning in 1982, which led to an awakened interest in the First Folio.
title: First Folio Theatre

text: Thomas Sowerby Hamblin (14 May 1800 – 8 January 1853) was an English actor and theatre manager.
title: Thomas S. Hamblin

text: He first took the stage in England, then immigrated to the United States in 1825.
title: Thomas S. Hamblin

text: He received critical acclaim there, and eventually entered theatre management.
title: Thomas S. Hamblin

text: During his tenure at New York City's Bowery Theatre he helped establish working-class theatre as a distinct form.
title: Thomas S. Hamblin

text: His policies preferred American actors and playwrights to British ones, making him an important influence in the development of early American drama.
title: Thomas S. Hamblin

text: The discography of American metalcore band As I Lay Dying consists of 6 studio albums, 2 compilation albums, 1 video album, 11 singles and 15 corresponding music videos as well as 1 split album with fellow metalcore band American Tragedy called "As I Lay Dying/American Tragedy".
title: As I Lay Dying discography

text: Glass Cloud was an American metalcore band from Hampton, Virginia formed by Jerry Roush, Joshua Travis, Travis Sykes, and Chad Hasty in late 2011.
title: Glass Cloud

text: The band released their debut album, "The Royal Thousand" on July 10, 2012 via Equal Vision Records in the United States and Basick Records in the United Kingdom.
title: Glass Cloud

text: Lead vocalist Roush was formerly the vocalist of Sky Eats Airplane and Of Mice & Men, while Joshua Travis was the guitarist for The Tony Danza Tapdance Extravaganza until 2012. "
title: Glass Cloud

text: Perfect War Forever" EP, and was released October 22, 2013 via Equal Vision Records.
title: Glass Cloud

text: St Valentines Massacre is an American metalcore band from Tampa, Florida, formed in 2005.
title: St Valentines Massacre (band)

text: The band members are: Tony Rodriguez the lead vocalist, guitarist/vocalist Paul Zakar, bassist Alan Olshefski, lead guitarist Tyler Jordan, and percussionist Andre Canale.
title: St Valentines Massacre (band)

text: Since their formation, SVM has issued three indie EP releases: "Of Heroes and Gods", "Beneath Crimson Skies", and "The Eulogy Sessions".
title: St Valentines Massacre (band)

text: In January 2007, they won the Rock Solid Pressure industry showcase, as well as placing at Emergenza and other events.
title: St Valentines Massacre (band)

text: St Valentines Massacre played the Ernie Ball stage as part of the 2007 Warped Tour, as well as their national tour in 2009.
title: St Valentines Massacre (band)

text: Bless the Martyr and Kiss the Child is the debut album by American metalcore band Norma Jean, released on August 13, 2002 by Solid State Records.
title: Bless the Martyr and Kiss the Child

text: This album was the band's only one to feature bassist Joshua Doolittle and vocalist Josh Scogin, the latter of which later became the lead vocalist of The Chariot.
title: Bless the Martyr and Kiss the Child

text: "Slave to Nothing" is a song by American metalcore band Fit for a King.
title: Slave to Nothing (song)

text: It's the second single from the album Slave to Nothing.
title: Slave to Nothing (song)

text: The song has a music video and features Mattie Montgomery, vocalist for metalcore band For Today.
title: Slave to Nothing (song)

text: Of Mice & Men (often abbreviated OM&M) is an American metalcore band from Orange County, California.
title: Of Mice & Men (band)

text: The band's lineup currently consists of lead vocalist and bassist Aaron Pauley, lead guitarist Phil Manansala, rhythm guitarist Alan Ashby, and drummer Valentino Arteaga.
title: Of Mice & Men (band)

text: The group was founded by Austin Carlile and Jaxin Hall in mid-2009 after Carlile's departure from Attack Attack!
title: Of Mice & Men (band)

text: Since 2009, the band has released four studio albums.
title: Of Mice & Men (band)

text: Carlile departed from the band in December 2016 citing that a long term health condition prompted his exit.
title: Of Mice & Men (band)

text: After Carlile's departure the band continue to pursue creating music with Pauley taking on both bassist and lead vocalist duties.
title: Of Mice & Men (band)

text: Sky Eats Airplane is the second album by American metalcore band Sky Eats Airplane.
title: Sky Eats Airplane (album)

text: The album was recorded in early 2008 with producer Brian McTernan and was released on July 22.
title: Sky Eats Airplane (album)

text: The album contains 11 tracks, 8 of which are new and 3 of which that are re-recorded versions of previously released demos.
title: Sky Eats Airplane (album)

text: The album is the band's first album as a 5 piece and without former vocalist/programmer Brack Cantrell.
title: Sky Eats Airplane (album)

text: It is also the first and last album with vocalist Jerry Roush.
title: Sky Eats Airplane (album)

text: Prior to the album's release a video for the first single "Numbers" was made and was released on March 27, 2009.
title: Sky Eats Airplane (album)

text: Sleepwalking is the debut full-length studio album by American metalcore band Memphis May Fire.
title: Sleepwalking (Memphis May Fire album)

text: The album was released through Trustkill Records on July 21, 2009.
title: Sleepwalking (Memphis May Fire album)

text: This album is the first album to feature lead vocalist Matty Mullins after former lead vocalist Chase Ryan left the band in 2008.
title: Sleepwalking (Memphis May Fire album)

text: Scheduled to be released summer 2008, the release got delayed because of the line-up change.
title: Sleepwalking (Memphis May Fire album)

text: Mullins has described the album as "a new breed of rock 'n' roll" and musically it has "more aggressive guitar work and noticeably more melodic, but still retains that southern swagger."
title: Sleepwalking (Memphis May Fire album)

text: Dead Throne is the fourth studio album by American metalcore band The Devil Wears Prada.
title: Dead Throne

text: It was released on September 13, 2011 through Ferret Music.
title: Dead Throne

text: Produced by Adam Dutkiewicz, the record was recorded in several studios across the United States from November 2010 – April 2011.
title: Dead Throne

text: The album is a follow up to The Devil Wears Prada's 2009 album, "With Roots Above and Branches Below".
title: Dead Throne

text: Much like their previous efforts the album's lyrics were penned by lead vocalist Mike Hranica, whose lyrical direction focused on anti-idolatry concepts.
title: Dead Throne

text: The band's musical style changed after the success of the "Zombie EP", this led to, what Hranica described as; fusing the melodic elements of their previous studio albums with the ferocity of "Zombie".
title: Dead Throne

text: The Rise Up Tour is a concert tour co-headlined by American metalcore band The Devil Wears Prada and American metalcore band Memphis May Fire.
title: Rise Up Tour

text: The tour supports The Devil Wears Prada's Sixth studio album, "Transit Blues" and Memphis May Fire's fifth studio album, "This Light I Hold".
title: Rise Up Tour

text: The second leg in Europe added Canadian post-hardcore band Silverstein as a third headliner supporting their eighth studio album "I Am Alive in Everything I Touch.
title: Rise Up Tour

text: Kiribati competed at the 2015 Pacific Games in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea from 4 to 18 July 2015.
title: Kiribati at the 2015 Pacific Games

text: A total of 86 competitors for Kiribati were listed as of 4 July 2015.
title: Kiribati at the 2015 Pacific Games

title: Nicolas N'Godrela

text: He won the Men's singles and Men's doubles gold medal at the 2015 Pacific Games.
title: Nicolas N'Godrela

text: Apart from that, he was also part of the New Caledonian Tennis Team which won Gold at the 2015 Pacific Games Men's Team Event.

text: Powerlifting at the 2015 Pacific Games was held from 9–10 July 2015 in the Sir John Guise Indoor Power Dome at Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea.

text: The host nation Papua New Guinea was the dominant team, particularly in the women's divisions where it claimed six of the seven possible gold medals.

text: Nauru was the strongest team in the men's divisions, winning four of the eight weight categories.

text: Telupe Iosefa received the first ever gold medal won by Tuvalu at the Pacific Games in the 120 kg male division.

text: The 2015 Pacific Games women's football tournament was the 4th edition of the Pacific Games women's football tournament.
title: Women's football at the 2015 Pacific Games

text: The women's football tournament was held in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea between 6–16 July 2015 as part of the 2015 Pacific Games.
title: Women's football at the 2015 Pacific Games

text: The tournament was open to full women's national teams (unlike the men's tournament, which was age-restricted).
title: Women's football at the 2015 Pacific Games

text: Basketball at the 2015 Pacific Games in Port Moresby, Papua New Guinea was held at the BSP Arena and PNG Power Dome on 3–12 July 2015.
title: Basketball at the 2015 Pacific Games

text: The 2015 Pacific Games men's football tournament was the 14th edition of the Pacific Games men's football tournament.
title: Men's football at the 2015 Pacific Games
